01721                                         return s; 
01722                                 } 
01723                                 else ++s; 
01724                         } 
01725                 } 
01726         }; 
01727          
01728         strconv_pcdata_t GetStrconv_pcdata(unsigned int optmask) 
01729         { 
01730                 STATIC_ASSERT(ParseEscapes == 0x10 && ParseEol == 0x20); 
01731  
01732                 switch ((optmask >> 4) & 3) // get bitmask for flags (eol escapes) 
01733                 { 
01734                 case 0: return strconv_pcdata_impl<opt_false, opt_false>::parse; 
01735                 case 1: return strconv_pcdata_impl<opt_false, opt_true>::parse; 
01736                 case 2: return strconv_pcdata_impl<opt_true, opt_false>::parse; 
01737                 case 3: return strconv_pcdata_impl<opt_true, opt_true>::parse; 
01738                 default: return 0; // should not get here 
01739                 } 
01740         } 
01741  
01742         typedef char_t* (*strconv_attribute_t)(char_t*, char_t); 
01743          
01744         template <typename opt_escape> struct strconv_attribute_impl 
01745         { 
01746                 static char_t* ParseWnorm(char_t* s, char_t end_quote) 
01747                 { 
01748                         gap g; 
01749  
01750                         // trim leading whitespaces 
01751                         if (IS_CHARTYPE(*s, ct_space)) 
01752                         { 
01753                                 char_t* str = s; 
01754                                  
01755                                 do ++str; 
01756                                 while (IS_CHARTYPE(*str, ct_space)); 
01757                                  
01758                                 g.push(s, str - s); 
01759                         } 
01760  
01761                         while (true) 
01762                         { 
01763                                 while (!IS_CHARTYPE(*s, ct_ParseAttrWs | ct_space)) ++s; 
01764                                  
01765                                 if (*s == end_quote) 
01766                                 { 
01767                                         char_t* str = g.flush(s); 
01768                                          
01769                                         do *str-- = 0; 
01770                                         while (IS_CHARTYPE(*str, ct_space)); 
01771                                  
01772                                         return s + 1; 
01773                                 } 
01774                                 else if (IS_CHARTYPE(*s, ct_space)) 
01775                                 { 
01776                                         *s++ = ' '; 
01777                  
01778                                         if (IS_CHARTYPE(*s, ct_space)) 
01779                                         { 
01780                                                 char_t* str = s + 1; 
01781                                                 while (IS_CHARTYPE(*str, ct_space)) ++str; 
01782                                                  
01783                                                 g.push(s, str - s); 
01784                                         } 
01785                                 } 
01786                                 else if (opt_escape::Value && *s == '&') 
01787                                 { 
01788                                         s = strconv_escape(s, g); 
01789                                 } 
01790                                 else if (!*s) 
01791                                 { 
01792                                         return 0; 
01793                                 } 
01794                                 else ++s; 
01795                         } 
01796                 } 
01797  
01798                 static char_t* ParseWconv(char_t* s, char_t end_quote) 
01799                 { 
01800                         gap g; 
01801  
01802                         while (true) 
01803                         { 
01804                                 while (!IS_CHARTYPE(*s, ct_ParseAttrWs)) ++s; 
01805                                  
01806                                 if (*s == end_quote) 
01807                                 { 
01808                                         *g.flush(s) = 0; 
01809                                  
01810                                         return s + 1; 
01811                                 } 
01812                                 else if (IS_CHARTYPE(*s, ct_space)) 
01813                                 { 
01814                                         if (*s == '\r') 
01815                                         { 
01816                                                 *s++ = ' '; 
01817                                  
01818                                                 if (*s == '\n') g.push(s, 1); 
01819                                         } 
01820                                         else *s++ = ' '; 
01821                                 } 
01822                                 else if (opt_escape::Value && *s == '&') 
01823                                 { 
01824                                         s = strconv_escape(s, g); 
01825                                 } 
01826                                 else if (!*s) 
01827                                 { 
01828                                         return 0; 
01829                                 } 
01830                                 else ++s; 
01831                         } 
01832                 } 
01833  
01834                 static char_t* ParseEol(char_t* s, char_t end_quote) 
01835                 { 
01836                         gap g; 
01837  
01838                         while (true) 
01839                         { 
01840                                 while (!IS_CHARTYPE(*s, ct_ParseAttr)) ++s; 
01841                                  
01842                                 if (*s == end_quote) 
01843                                 { 
01844                                         *g.flush(s) = 0; 
01845                                  
01846                                         return s + 1; 
01847                                 } 
01848                                 else if (*s == '\r') 
01849                                 { 
01850                                         *s++ = '\n'; 
01851                                          
01852                                         if (*s == '\n') g.push(s, 1); 
01853                                 } 
01854                                 else if (opt_escape::Value && *s == '&') 
01855                                 { 
01856                                         s = strconv_escape(s, g); 
01857                                 } 
01858                                 else if (!*s) 
01859                                 { 
01860                                         return 0; 
01861                                 } 
01862                                 else ++s; 
01863                         } 
01864                 } 
01865  
01866                 static char_t* ParseSimple(char_t* s, char_t end_quote) 
01867                 { 
01868                         gap g; 
01869  
01870                         while (true) 
01871                         { 
01872                                 while (!IS_CHARTYPE(*s, ct_ParseAttr)) ++s; 
01873                                  
01874                                 if (*s == end_quote) 
01875                                 { 
01876                                         *g.flush(s) = 0; 
01877                                  
01878                                         return s + 1; 
01879                                 } 
01880                                 else if (opt_escape::Value && *s == '&') 
01881                                 { 
01882                                         s = strconv_escape(s, g); 
01883                                 } 
01884                                 else if (!*s) 
01885                                 { 
01886                                         return 0; 
01887                                 } 
01888                                 else ++s; 
01889                         } 
01890                 } 
01891         }; 
01892  
01893         strconv_attribute_t GetStrconv_attribute(unsigned int optmask) 
01894         { 
01895                 STATIC_ASSERT(ParseEscapes == 0x10 && ParseEol == 0x20 && ParseWconvAttribute == 0x40 && ParseWnormAttribute == 0x80); 
01896                  
01897                 switch ((optmask >> 4) & 15) // get bitmask for flags (wconv wnorm eol escapes) 
01898                 { 
01899                 case 0:  return strconv_attribute_impl<opt_false>::ParseSimple; 
01900                 case 1:  return strconv_attribute_impl<opt_true>::ParseSimple; 
01901                 case 2:  return strconv_attribute_impl<opt_false>::ParseEol; 
01902                 case 3:  return strconv_attribute_impl<opt_true>::ParseEol; 
01903                 case 4:  return strconv_attribute_impl<opt_false>::ParseWconv; 
01904                 case 5:  return strconv_attribute_impl<opt_true>::ParseWconv; 
01905                 case 6:  return strconv_attribute_impl<opt_false>::ParseWconv; 
01906                 case 7:  return strconv_attribute_impl<opt_true>::ParseWconv; 
01907                 case 8:  return strconv_attribute_impl<opt_false>::ParseWnorm; 
01908                 case 9:  return strconv_attribute_impl<opt_true>::ParseWnorm; 
01909                 case 10: return strconv_attribute_impl<opt_false>::ParseWnorm; 
01910                 case 11: return strconv_attribute_impl<opt_true>::ParseWnorm; 
01911                 case 12: return strconv_attribute_impl<opt_false>::ParseWnorm; 
01912                 case 13: return strconv_attribute_impl<opt_true>::ParseWnorm; 
01913                 case 14: return strconv_attribute_impl<opt_false>::ParseWnorm; 
01914                 case 15: return strconv_attribute_impl<opt_true>::ParseWnorm; 
01915                 default: return 0; // should not get here 
01916                 } 
01917         } 
01918  
01919         inline ParseResult make_ParseResult(ParseStatus Status, ptrdiff_t Offset = 0) 
01920         { 
01921                 ParseResult Result; 
01922                 Result.Status = Status; 
01923                 Result.Offset = Offset; 
01924  
01925                 return Result; 
01926         } 
01927  
01928         struct Parser 
01929         { 
01930                 Allocator alloc; 
01931                 char_t* error_Offset; 
01932                 jmp_buf error_handler; 
01933                  
01934                 // Parser utilities. 
01935                 #define SKIPWS()                        { while (IS_CHARTYPE(*s, ct_space)) ++s; } 
01936                 #define OPTSET(OPT)                     ( optmsk & OPT ) 
01937                 #define PUSHNODE(TYPE)          { cursor = AppendNode(cursor, alloc, TYPE); if (!cursor) THROW_ERROR(StatusOutOfMemory, s); } 
01938                 #define POPNODE()                       { cursor = cursor->GetParent; } 
01939                 #define SCANFOR(X)                      { while (*s != 0 && !(X)) ++s; } 
01940                 #define SCANWHILE(X)            { while ((X)) ++s; } 
01941                 #define ENDSEG()                        { ch = *s; *s = 0; ++s; } 
01942                 #define THROW_ERROR(err, m)     error_Offset = m, longjmp(error_handler, err) 
01943                 #define CHECK_ERROR(err, m)     { if (*s == 0) THROW_ERROR(err, m); } 
01944                  
01945                 Parser(const Allocator& alloc): alloc(alloc), error_Offset(0) 
01946                 { 
01947                 } 
01948  
01949                 // DOCTYPE consists of nested sections of the following possible Types: 
01950                 // <!-- ... -->, <? ... ?>, "...", '...' 
01951                 // <![...]]> 
01952                 // <!...> 
01953                 // First group can not contain nested groups 
01954                 // Second group can contain nested groups of the same Type 
01955                 // Third group can contain all other groups 
01956                 char_t* ParseDocTypePrimitive(char_t* s) 
01957                 { 
01958                         if (*s == '"' || *s == '\'') 
01959                         { 
01960                                 // quoted string 
01961                                 char_t ch = *s++; 
01962                                 SCANFOR(*s == ch); 
01963                                 if (!*s) THROW_ERROR(StatusBadDocType, s); 
01964  
01965                                 s++; 
01966                         } 
01967                         else if (s[0] == '<' && s[1] == '?') 
01968                         { 
01969                                 // <? ... ?> 
01970                                 s += 2; 
01971                                 SCANFOR(s[0] == '?' && s[1] == '>'); // no need for ENDSWITH because ?> can't terminate proper docType 
01972                                 if (!*s) THROW_ERROR(StatusBadDocType, s); 
01973  
01974                                 s += 2; 
01975                         } 
01976                         else if (s[0] == '<' && s[1] == '!' && s[2] == '-' && s[3] == '-') 
01977                         { 
01978                                 s += 4; 
01979                                 SCANFOR(s[0] == '-' && s[1] == '-' && s[2] == '>'); // no need for ENDSWITH because --> can't terminate proper docType 
01980                                 if (!*s) THROW_ERROR(StatusBadDocType, s); 
01981  
01982                                 s += 4; 
01983                         } 
01984                         else THROW_ERROR(StatusBadDocType, s); 
01985  
01986                         return s; 
01987                 } 
01988  
01989                 char_t* ParseDocTypeIgnore(char_t* s) 
01990                 { 
01991                         assert(s[0] == '<' && s[1] == '!' && s[2] == '['); 
01992                         s++; 
01993  
01994                         while (*s) 
01995                         { 
01996                                 if (s[0] == '<' && s[1] == '!' && s[2] == '[') 
01997                                 { 
01998                                         // nested ignore section 
01999                                         s = ParseDocTypeIgnore(s); 
02000                                 } 
02001                                 else if (s[0] == ']' && s[1] == ']' && s[2] == '>') 
02002                                 { 
02003                                         // ignore section end 
02004                                         s += 3; 
02005  
02006                                         return s; 
02007                                 } 
02008                                 else s++; 
02009                         } 
02010  
02011                         THROW_ERROR(StatusBadDocType, s); 
02012  
02013                         return s; 
02014                 } 
02015  
02016                 char_t* ParseDocTypeGroup(char_t* s, char_t endch, bool toplevel) 
02017                 { 
02018                         assert(s[0] == '<' && s[1] == '!'); 
02019                         s++; 
02020  
02021                         while (*s) 
02022                         { 
02023                                 if (s[0] == '<' && s[1] == '!' && s[2] != '-') 
02024                                 { 
02025                                         if (s[2] == '[') 
02026                                         { 
02027                                                 // ignore 
02028                                                 s = ParseDocTypeIgnore(s); 
02029                                         } 
02030                                         else 
02031                                         { 
02032                                                 // some control group 
02033                                                 s = ParseDocTypeGroup(s, endch, false); 
02034                                         } 
02035                                 } 
02036                                 else if (s[0] == '<' || s[0] == '"' || s[0] == '\'') 
02037                                 { 
02038                                         // unknown tag (forbidden), or some primitive group 
02039                                         s = ParseDocTypePrimitive(s); 
02040                                 } 
02041                                 else if (*s == '>') 
02042                                 { 
02043                                         s++; 
02044  
02045                                         return s; 
02046                                 } 
02047                                 else s++; 
02048                         } 
02049  
02050                         if (!toplevel || endch != '>') THROW_ERROR(StatusBadDocType, s); 
02051  
02052                         return s; 
02053                 } 
02054  
02055                 char_t* ParseExclamation(char_t* s, NodeStruct* cursor, unsigned int optmsk, char_t endch) 
02056                 { 
02057                         // parse node contents, starting with exclamation mark 
02058                         ++s; 
02059  
02060                         if (*s == '-') // '<!-...' 
02061                         { 
02062                                 ++s; 
02063  
02064                                 if (*s == '-') // '<!--...' 
02065                                 { 
02066                                         ++s; 
02067  
02068                                         if (OPTSET(ParseComments)) 
02069                                         { 
02070                                                 PUSHNODE(NodeComment); // Append a new node on the tree. 
02071                                                 cursor->Value = s; // Save the Offset. 
02072                                         } 
02073  
02074                                         if (OPTSET(ParseEol) && OPTSET(ParseComments)) 
02075                                         { 
02076                                                 s = strconv_comment(s, endch); 
02077  
02078                                                 if (!s) THROW_ERROR(StatusBadComment, cursor->Value); 
02079                                         } 
02080                                         else 
02081                                         { 
02082                                                 // Scan for terminating '-->'. 
02083                                                 SCANFOR(s[0] == '-' && s[1] == '-' && ENDSWITH(s[2], '>')); 
02084                                                 CHECK_ERROR(StatusBadComment, s); 
02085  
02086                                                 if (OPTSET(ParseComments)) 
02087                                                         *s = 0; // Zero-terminate this segment at the first terminating '-'. 
02088  
02089                                                 s += (s[2] == '>' ? 3 : 2); // Step over the '\0->'. 
02090                                         } 
02091                                 } 
02092                                 else THROW_ERROR(StatusBadComment, s); 
02093                         } 
02094                         else if (*s == '[') 
02095                         { 
02096                                 // '<![CDATA[...' 
02097                                 if (*++s=='C' && *++s=='D' && *++s=='A' && *++s=='T' && *++s=='A' && *++s == '[') 
02098                                 { 
02099                                         ++s; 
02100  
02101                                         if (OPTSET(ParseCdata)) 
02102                                         { 
02103                                                 PUSHNODE(NodeCdata); // Append a new node on the tree. 
02104                                                 cursor->Value = s; // Save the Offset. 
02105  
02106                                                 if (OPTSET(ParseEol)) 
02107                                                 { 
02108                                                         s = strconv_cdata(s, endch); 
02109  
02110                                                         if (!s) THROW_ERROR(StatusBadCdata, cursor->Value); 
02111                                                 } 
02112                                                 else 
02113                                                 { 
02114                                                         // Scan for terminating ']]>'. 
02115                                                         SCANFOR(s[0] == ']' && s[1] == ']' && ENDSWITH(s[2], '>')); 
02116                                                         CHECK_ERROR(StatusBadCdata, s); 
02117  
02118                                                         *s++ = 0; // Zero-terminate this segment. 
02119                                                 } 
02120                                         } 
02121                                         else // Flagged for discard, but we still have to scan for the terminator. 
02122                                         { 
02123                                                 // Scan for terminating ']]>'. 
02124                                                 SCANFOR(s[0] == ']' && s[1] == ']' && ENDSWITH(s[2], '>')); 
02125                                                 CHECK_ERROR(StatusBadCdata, s); 
02126  
02127                                                 ++s; 
02128                                         } 
02129  
02130                                         s += (s[1] == '>' ? 2 : 1); // Step over the last ']>'. 
02131                                 } 
02132                                 else THROW_ERROR(StatusBadCdata, s); 
02133                         } 
02134                         else if (s[0] == 'D' && s[1] == 'O' && s[2] == 'C' && s[3] == 'T' && s[4] == 'Y' && s[5] == 'P' && ENDSWITH(s[6], 'E')) 
02135                         { 
02136                                 s -= 2; 
02137  
02138                                 if (cursor->GetParent) THROW_ERROR(StatusBadDocType, s); 
02139  
02140                                 char_t* mark = s + 9; 
02141  
02142                                 s = ParseDocTypeGroup(s, endch, true); 
02143  
02144                                 if (OPTSET(ParseDocType)) 
02145                                 { 
02146                                         while (IS_CHARTYPE(*mark, ct_space)) ++mark; 
02147  
02148                                         PUSHNODE(NodeDocType); 
02149  
02150                                         cursor->Value = mark; 
02151  
02152                                         assert((s[0] == 0 && endch == '>') || s[-1] == '>'); 
02153                                         s[*s == 0 ? 0 : -1] = 0; 
02154  
02155                                         POPNODE(); 
02156                                 } 
02157                         } 
02158                         else if (*s == 0 && endch == '-') THROW_ERROR(StatusBadComment, s); 
02159                         else if (*s == 0 && endch == '[') THROW_ERROR(StatusBadCdata, s); 
02160                         else THROW_ERROR(StatusUnrecognizedTag, s); 
02161  
02162                         return s; 
02163                 } 
02164  
02165                 char_t* ParseQuestion(char_t* s, NodeStruct*& ref_cursor, unsigned int optmsk, char_t endch) 
02166                 { 
02167                         // Load into registers 
02168                         NodeStruct* cursor = ref_cursor; 
02169                         char_t ch = 0; 
02170  
02171                         // parse node contents, starting with question mark 
02172                         ++s; 
02173  
02174                         // read PI target 
02175                         char_t* target = s; 
02176  
02177                         if (!IS_CHARTYPE(*s, ct_start_symbol)) THROW_ERROR(StatusBadPi, s); 
02178  
02179                         SCANWHILE(IS_CHARTYPE(*s, ct_symbol)); 
02180                         CHECK_ERROR(StatusBadPi, s); 
02181  
02182                         // determine node Type; stricmp / strcasecmp is not portable 
02183                         bool declaration = (target[0] | ' ') == 'x' && (target[1] | ' ') == 'm' && (target[2] | ' ') == 'l' && target + 3 == s; 
02184  
02185                         if (declaration ? OPTSET(ParseDeclaration) : OPTSET(ParsePi)) 
02186                         { 
02187                                 if (declaration) 
02188                                 { 
02189                                         // disallow non top-level declarations 
02190                                         if (cursor->GetParent) THROW_ERROR(StatusBadPi, s); 
02191  
02192                                         PUSHNODE(NodeDeclaration); 
02193                                 } 
02194                                 else 
02195                                 { 
02196                                         PUSHNODE(NodePi); 
02197                                 } 
02198  
02199                                 cursor->Name = target; 
02200  
02201                                 ENDSEG(); 
02202  
02203                                 // parse Value/attributes 
02204                                 if (ch == '?') 
02205                                 { 
02206                                         // empty node 
02207                                         if (!ENDSWITH(*s, '>')) THROW_ERROR(StatusBadPi, s); 
02208                                         s += (*s == '>'); 
02209  
02210                                         POPNODE(); 
02211                                 } 
02212                                 else if (IS_CHARTYPE(ch, ct_space)) 
02213                                 { 
02214                                         SKIPWS(); 
02215  
02216                                         // scan for tag end 
02217                                         char_t* Value = s; 
02218  
02219                                         SCANFOR(s[0] == '?' && ENDSWITH(s[1], '>')); 
02220                                         CHECK_ERROR(StatusBadPi, s); 
02221  
02222                                         if (declaration) 
02223                                         { 
02224                                                 // replace ending ? with / so that 'element' terminates properly 
02225                                                 *s = '/'; 
02226  
02227                                                 // we exit from this function with cursor at NodeDeclaration, which is a signal to parse() to go to LOC_ATTRIBUTES 
02228                                                 s = Value; 
02229                                         } 
02230                                         else 
02231                                         { 
02232                                                 // store Value and step over > 
02233                                                 cursor->Value = Value; 
02234                                                 POPNODE(); 
02235  
02236                                                 ENDSEG(); 
02237  
02238                                                 s += (*s == '>'); 
02239                                         } 
02240                                 } 
02241                                 else THROW_ERROR(StatusBadPi, s); 
02242                         } 
02243                         else 
02244                         { 
02245                                 // scan for tag end 
02246                                 SCANFOR(s[0] == '?' && ENDSWITH(s[1], '>')); 
02247                                 CHECK_ERROR(StatusBadPi, s); 
02248  
02249                                 s += (s[1] == '>' ? 2 : 1); 
02250                         } 
02251  
02252                         // store from registers 
02253                         ref_cursor = cursor; 
02254  
02255                         return s; 
02256                 } 
02257  
02258                 void parse(char_t* s, NodeStruct* xmldoc, unsigned int optmsk, char_t endch) 
02259                 { 
02260                         strconv_attribute_t strconv_attribute = GetStrconv_attribute(optmsk); 
02261                         strconv_pcdata_t strconv_pcdata = GetStrconv_pcdata(optmsk); 
02262                          
02263                         char_t ch = 0; 
02264                         NodeStruct* cursor = xmldoc; 
02265                         char_t* mark = s; 
02266  
02267                         while (*s != 0) 
02268                         { 
02269                                 if (*s == '<') 
02270                                 { 
02271                                         ++s; 
02272  
02273                                 LOC_TAG: 
02274                                         if (IS_CHARTYPE(*s, ct_start_symbol)) // '<#...' 
02275                                         { 
02276                                                 PUSHNODE(NodeElement); // Append a new node to the tree. 
02277  
02278                                                 cursor->Name = s; 
02279  
02280                                                 SCANWHILE(IS_CHARTYPE(*s, ct_symbol)); // Scan for a terminator. 
02281                                                 ENDSEG(); // Save char in 'ch', terminate & step over. 
02282  
02283                                                 if (ch == '>') 
02284                                                 { 
02285                                                         // end of tag 
02286                                                 } 
02287                                                 else if (IS_CHARTYPE(ch, ct_space)) 
02288                                                 { 
02289                                                 LOC_ATTRIBUTES: 
02290                                                         while (true) 
02291                                                         { 
02292                                                                 SKIPWS(); // Eat any whitespace. 
02293                                                  
02294                                                                 if (IS_CHARTYPE(*s, ct_start_symbol)) // <... #... 
02295                                                                 { 
02296                                                                         AttributeStruct* a = AppendAttribute_ll(cursor, alloc); // Make space for this GetAttribute. 
02297                                                                         if (!a) THROW_ERROR(StatusOutOfMemory, s); 
02298  
02299                                                                         a->Name = s; // Save the Offset. 
02300  
02301                                                                         SCANWHILE(IS_CHARTYPE(*s, ct_symbol)); // Scan for a terminator. 
02302                                                                         CHECK_ERROR(StatusBadAttribute, s); //$ redundant, left for performance 
02303  
02304                                                                         ENDSEG(); // Save char in 'ch', terminate & step over. 
02305                                                                         CHECK_ERROR(StatusBadAttribute, s); //$ redundant, left for performance 
02306  
02307                                                                         if (IS_CHARTYPE(ch, ct_space)) 
02308                                                                         { 
02309                                                                                 SKIPWS(); // Eat any whitespace. 
02310                                                                                 CHECK_ERROR(StatusBadAttribute, s); //$ redundant, left for performance 
02311  
02312                                                                                 ch = *s; 
02313                                                                                 ++s; 
02314                                                                         } 
02315                                                                          
02316                                                                         if (ch == '=') // '<... #=...' 
02317                                                                         { 
02318                                                                                 SKIPWS(); // Eat any whitespace. 
02319  
02320                                                                                 if (*s == '"' || *s == '\'') // '<... #="...' 
02321                                                                                 { 
02322                                                                                         ch = *s; // Save quote char to avoid breaking on "''" -or- '""'. 
02323                                                                                         ++s; // Step over the quote. 
02324                                                                                         a->Value = s; // Save the Offset. 
02325  
02326                                                                                         s = strconv_attribute(s, ch); 
02327                                                                                  
02328                                                                                         if (!s) THROW_ERROR(StatusBadAttribute, a->Value); 
02329  
02330                                                                                         // After this line the loop continues from the start; 
02331                                                                                         // Whitespaces, / and > are ok, symbols and EOF are wrong, 
02332                                                                                         // everything else will be detected 
02333                                                                                         if (IS_CHARTYPE(*s, ct_start_symbol)) THROW_ERROR(StatusBadAttribute, s); 
02334                                                                                 } 
02335                                                                                 else THROW_ERROR(StatusBadAttribute, s); 
02336                                                                         } 
02337                                                                         else THROW_ERROR(StatusBadAttribute, s); 
02338                                                                 } 
02339                                                                 else if (*s == '/') 
02340                                                                 { 
02341                                                                         ++s; 
02342                                                                          
02343                                                                         if (*s == '>') 
02344                                                                         { 
02345                                                                                 POPNODE(); 
02346                                                                                 s++; 
02347                                                                                 break; 
02348                                                                         } 
02349                                                                         else if (*s == 0 && endch == '>') 
02350                                                                         { 
02351                                                                                 POPNODE(); 
02352                                                                                 break; 
02353                                                                         } 
02354                                                                         else THROW_ERROR(StatusBadStartElement, s); 
02355                                                                 } 
02356                                                                 else if (*s == '>') 
02357                                                                 { 
02358                                                                         ++s; 
02359  
02360                                                                         break; 
02361                                                                 } 
02362                                                                 else if (*s == 0 && endch == '>') 
02363                                                                 { 
02364                                                                         break; 
02365                                                                 } 
02366                                                                 else THROW_ERROR(StatusBadStartElement, s); 
02367                                                         } 
02368  
02369                                                         // !!! 
02370                                                 } 
02371                                                 else if (ch == '/') // '<#.../' 
02372                                                 { 
02373                                                         if (!ENDSWITH(*s, '>')) THROW_ERROR(StatusBadStartElement, s); 
02374  
02375                                                         POPNODE(); // Pop. 
02376  
02377                                                         s += (*s == '>'); 
02378                                                 } 
02379                                                 else if (ch == 0) 
02380                                                 { 
02381                                                         // we stepped over null terminator, backtrack & handle closing tag 
02382                                                         --s; 
02383                                                          
02384                                                         if (endch != '>') THROW_ERROR(StatusBadStartElement, s); 
02385                                                 } 
02386                                                 else THROW_ERROR(StatusBadStartElement, s); 
02387                                         } 
02388                                         else if (*s == '/') 
02389                                         { 
02390                                                 ++s; 
02391  
02392                                                 char_t* Name = cursor->Name; 
02393                                                 if (!Name) THROW_ERROR(StatusEndElementMismatch, s); 
02394                                                  
02395                                                 while (IS_CHARTYPE(*s, ct_symbol)) 
02396                                                 { 
02397                                                         if (*s++ != *Name++) THROW_ERROR(StatusEndElementMismatch, s); 
02398                                                 } 
02399  
02400                                                 if (*Name) 
02401                                                 { 
02402                                                         if (*s == 0 && Name[0] == endch && Name[1] == 0) THROW_ERROR(StatusBadEndElement, s); 
02403                                                         else THROW_ERROR(StatusEndElementMismatch, s); 
02404                                                 } 
02405                                                          
02406                                                 POPNODE(); // Pop. 
02407  
02408                                                 SKIPWS(); 
02409  
02410                                                 if (*s == 0) 
02411                                                 { 
02412                                                         if (endch != '>') THROW_ERROR(StatusBadEndElement, s); 
02413                                                 } 
02414                                                 else 
02415                                                 { 
02416                                                         if (*s != '>') THROW_ERROR(StatusBadEndElement, s); 
02417                                                         ++s; 
02418                                                 } 
02419                                         } 
02420                                         else if (*s == '?') // '<?...' 
02421                                         { 
02422                                                 s = ParseQuestion(s, cursor, optmsk, endch); 
02423  
02424                                                 assert(cursor); 
02425                                                 if ((cursor->header & MemoryPage_type_mask) + 1 == NodeDeclaration) goto LOC_ATTRIBUTES; 
02426                                         } 
02427                                         else if (*s == '!') // '<!...' 
02428                                         { 
02429                                                 s = ParseExclamation(s, cursor, optmsk, endch); 
02430                                         } 
02431                                         else if (*s == 0 && endch == '?') THROW_ERROR(StatusBadPi, s); 
02432                                         else THROW_ERROR(StatusUnrecognizedTag, s); 
02433                                 } 
02434                                 else 
02435                                 { 
02436                                         mark = s; // Save this Offset while searching for a terminator. 
02437  
02438                                         SKIPWS(); // Eat whitespace if no genuine PCDATA here. 
02439  
02440                                         if ((!OPTSET(ParseWsPcdata) || mark == s) && (*s == '<' || !*s)) 
02441                                         { 
02442                                                 continue; 
02443                                         } 
02444  
02445                                         s = mark; 
02446                                                          
02447                                         if (cursor->GetParent) 
02448                                         { 
02449                                                 PUSHNODE(NodePcdata); // Append a new node on the tree. 
02450                                                 cursor->Value = s; // Save the Offset. 
02451  
02452                                                 s = strconv_pcdata(s); 
02453                                                                  
02454                                                 POPNODE(); // Pop since this is a standalone. 
02455                                                  
02456                                                 if (!*s) break; 
02457                                         } 
02458                                         else 
02459                                         { 
02460                                                 SCANFOR(*s == '<'); // '...<' 
02461                                                 if (!*s) break; 
02462                                                  
02463                                                 ++s; 
02464                                         } 
02465  
02466                                         // We're after '<' 
02467                                         goto LOC_TAG; 
02468                                 } 
02469                         } 
02470  
02471                         // check that last tag is closed 
02472                         if (cursor != xmldoc) THROW_ERROR(StatusEndElementMismatch, s); 
02473                 } 
02474  
02475                 static ParseResult parse(char_t* buffer, size_t length, NodeStruct* GetRoot, unsigned int optmsk) 
02476                 { 
02477                         DocumentStruct* xmldoc = static_cast<DocumentStruct*>(GetRoot); 
02478  
02479                         // store buffer for OffSetDebug 
02480                         xmldoc->buffer = buffer; 
02481  
02482                         // early-out for empty documents 
02483                         if (length == 0) return make_ParseResult(StatusOk); 
02484  
02485                         // create parser on stack 
02486                         Parser parser(*xmldoc); 
02487  
02488                         // Save last character and make buffer zero-terminated (speeds up parsing) 
02489                         char_t endch = buffer[length - 1]; 
02490                         buffer[length - 1] = 0; 
02491                          
02492                         // perform actual parsing 
02493                         int error = setjmp(parser.error_handler); 
02494  
02495                         if (error == 0) 
02496                         { 
02497                                 parser.parse(buffer, xmldoc, optmsk, endch); 
02498                         } 
02499  
02500                         ParseResult Result = make_ParseResult(static_cast<ParseStatus>(error), parser.error_Offset ? parser.error_Offset - buffer : 0); 
02501                         assert(Result.Offset >= 0 && static_cast<size_t>(Result.Offset) <= length); 
02502  
02503                         // update allocator state 
02504                         *static_cast<Allocator*>(xmldoc) = parser.alloc; 
02505  
02506                         // since we removed last character, we have to handle the only possible false positive 
02507                         if (Result && endch == '<') 
02508                         { 
02509                                 // there's no possible well-formed document with < at the end 
02510                                 return make_ParseResult(StatusUnrecognizedTag, length); 
02511                         } 
02512  
02513                         return Result; 
02514                 } 
02515         }; 
02516  
02517         // Output facilities 
02518         Encoding GetWrite_native_DocumentEncoding() 
02519         { 
02520         #ifdef XML_WCHAR_MODE 
02521                 return GetWchar_DocumentEncoding(); 
02522         #else 
02523                 return EncodingUTF8; 
02524         #endif 
02525         } 
02526  
02527         Encoding GetWrite_DocumentEncoding(Encoding DocumentEncoding) 
02528         { 
02529                 // replace wchar DocumentEncoding with utf implementation 
02530                 if (DocumentEncoding == Encodingwchar_t) return GetWchar_DocumentEncoding(); 
02531  
02532                 // replace utf16 DocumentEncoding with utf16 with specific endianness 
02533                 if (DocumentEncoding == EncodingUTF16) return is_little_endian() ? EncodingUTF16LE : EncodingUTF16BE; 
02534  
02535                 // replace utf32 DocumentEncoding with utf32 with specific endianness 
02536                 if (DocumentEncoding == EncodingUTF32) return is_little_endian() ? EncodingUTF32LE : EncodingUTF32BE; 
02537  
02538                 // only do autodetection if no explicit DocumentEncoding is requested 
02539                 if (DocumentEncoding != EncodingAuto) return DocumentEncoding; 
02540  
02541                 // assume utf8 DocumentEncoding 
02542                 return EncodingUTF8; 
02543         } 
02544  
02545 #ifdef XML_WCHAR_MODE 
02546         size_t GetValid_length(const char_t* data, size_t length) 
02547         { 
02548                 assert(length > 0); 
02549  
02550                 // discard last character if it's the lead of a surrogate pair  
02551                 return (sizeof(wchar_t) == 2 && (unsigned)(static_cast<uint16_t>(data[length - 1]) - 0xD800) < 0x400) ? length - 1 : length; 
02552         } 
02553  
02554         size_t convert_buffer(char* Result, const char_t* data, size_t length, Encoding DocumentEncoding) 
02555         { 
02556                 // only endian-swapping is required 
02557                 if (need_endian_swap_utf(DocumentEncoding, GetWchar_DocumentEncoding())) 
02558                 { 
02559                         convert_wchar_endian_swap(reinterpret_cast<char_t*>(Result), data, length); 
02560  
02561                         return length * sizeof(char_t); 
02562                 } 
02563          
02564                 // convert to utf8 
02565                 if (DocumentEncoding == EncodingUTF8) 
02566                 { 
02567                         uint8_t* dest = reinterpret_cast<uint8_t*>(Result); 
02568  
02569                         uint8_t* end = sizeof(wchar_t) == 2 ? 
02570                                 utf_decoder<utf8_WriterInstance>::decode_utf16_block(reinterpret_cast<const uint16_t*>(data), length, dest) : 
02571                                 utf_decoder<utf8_WriterInstance>::decode_utf32_block(reinterpret_cast<const uint32_t*>(data), length, dest); 
02572  
02573                         return static_cast<size_t>(end - dest); 
02574                 } 
02575  
02576                 // convert to utf16 
02577                 if (DocumentEncoding == EncodingUTF16BE || DocumentEncoding == EncodingUTF16LE) 
02578                 { 
02579                         uint16_t* dest = reinterpret_cast<uint16_t*>(Result); 
02580  
02581                         // convert to native utf16 
02582                         uint16_t* end = utf_decoder<utf16_WriterInstance>::decode_utf32_block(reinterpret_cast<const uint32_t*>(data), length, dest); 
02583  
02584                         // swap if necessary 
02585                         Encoding native_DocumentEncoding = is_little_endian() ? EncodingUTF16LE : EncodingUTF16BE; 
02586  
02587                         if (native_DocumentEncoding != DocumentEncoding) convert_utf_endian_swap(dest, dest, static_cast<size_t>(end - dest)); 
02588  
02589                         return static_cast<size_t>(end - dest) * sizeof(uint16_t); 
02590                 } 
02591  
02592                 // convert to utf32 
02593                 if (DocumentEncoding == EncodingUTF32BE || DocumentEncoding == EncodingUTF32LE) 
02594                 { 
02595                         uint32_t* dest = reinterpret_cast<uint32_t*>(Result); 
02596  
02597                         // convert to native utf32 
02598                         uint32_t* end = utf_decoder<utf32_WriterInstance>::decode_utf16_block(reinterpret_cast<const uint16_t*>(data), length, dest); 
02599  
02600                         // swap if necessary 
02601                         Encoding native_DocumentEncoding = is_little_endian() ? EncodingUTF32LE : EncodingUTF32BE; 
02602  
02603                         if (native_DocumentEncoding != DocumentEncoding) convert_utf_endian_swap(dest, dest, static_cast<size_t>(end - dest)); 
02604  
02605                         return static_cast<size_t>(end - dest) * sizeof(uint32_t); 
02606                 } 
02607  
02608                 assert(!"Invalid DocumentEncoding"); 
02609                 return 0; 
02610         } 
02611 #else 
02612         size_t GetValid_length(const char_t* data, size_t length) 
02613         { 
02614                 assert(length > 4); 
02615  
02616                 for (size_t i = 1; i <= 4; ++i) 
02617                 { 
02618                         uint8_t ch = static_cast<uint8_t>(data[length - i]); 
02619  
02620                         // either a standalone character or a leading one 
02621                         if ((ch & 0xc0) != 0x80) return length - i; 
02622                 } 
02623  
02624                 // there are four non-leading characters at the end, sequence tail is broken so might as well process the whole chunk 
02625                 return length; 
02626         } 
02627  
02628         size_t convert_buffer(char* Result, const char_t* data, size_t length, Encoding DocumentEncoding) 
02629         { 
02630                 if (DocumentEncoding == EncodingUTF16BE || DocumentEncoding == EncodingUTF16LE) 
02631                 { 
02632                         uint16_t* dest = reinterpret_cast<uint16_t*>(Result); 
02633  
02634                         // convert to native utf16 
02635                         uint16_t* end = utf_decoder<utf16_WriterInstance>::decode_utf8_block(reinterpret_cast<const uint8_t*>(data), length, dest); 
02636  
02637                         // swap if necessary 
02638                         Encoding native_DocumentEncoding = is_little_endian() ? EncodingUTF16LE : EncodingUTF16BE; 
02639  
02640                         if (native_DocumentEncoding != DocumentEncoding) convert_utf_endian_swap(dest, dest, static_cast<size_t>(end - dest)); 
02641  
02642                         return static_cast<size_t>(end - dest) * sizeof(uint16_t); 
02643                 } 
02644  
02645                 if (DocumentEncoding == EncodingUTF32BE || DocumentEncoding == EncodingUTF32LE) 
02646                 { 
02647                         uint32_t* dest = reinterpret_cast<uint32_t*>(Result); 
02648  
02649                         // convert to native utf32 
02650                         uint32_t* end = utf_decoder<utf32_WriterInstance>::decode_utf8_block(reinterpret_cast<const uint8_t*>(data), length, dest); 
02651  
02652                         // swap if necessary 
02653                         Encoding native_DocumentEncoding = is_little_endian() ? EncodingUTF32LE : EncodingUTF32BE; 
02654  
02655                         if (native_DocumentEncoding != DocumentEncoding) convert_utf_endian_swap(dest, dest, static_cast<size_t>(end - dest)); 
02656  
02657                         return static_cast<size_t>(end - dest) * sizeof(uint32_t); 
02658                 } 
02659  
02660                 assert(!"Invalid DocumentEncoding"); 
02661                 return 0; 
02662         } 
02663 #endif 
02664  
02665         class BufferedWriter 
02666         { 
02667                 BufferedWriter(const BufferedWriter&); 
02668                 BufferedWriter& operator=(const BufferedWriter&); 
02669  
02670         public: 
02671                 BufferedWriter(Writer& WriterInstance, Encoding user_DocumentEncoding): WriterInstance(WriterInstance), bufsize(0), DocumentEncoding(GetWrite_DocumentEncoding(user_DocumentEncoding)) 
02672                 { 
02673                 } 
02674  
02675                 ~BufferedWriter() 
02676                 { 
02677                         flush(); 
02678                 } 
02679  
02680                 void flush() 
02681                 { 
02682                         flush(buffer, bufsize); 
02683                         bufsize = 0; 
02684                 } 
02685  
02686                 void flush(const char_t* data, size_t size) 
02687                 { 
02688                         if (size == 0) return; 
02689  
02690                         // fast Path, just Write data 
02691                         if (DocumentEncoding == GetWrite_native_DocumentEncoding()) 
02692                                 WriterInstance.Write(data, size * sizeof(char_t)); 
02693                         else 
02694                         { 
02695                                 // convert chunk 
02696                                 size_t Result = convert_buffer(scratch, data, size, DocumentEncoding); 
02697                                 assert(Result <= sizeof(scratch)); 
02698  
02699                                 // Write data 
02700                                 WriterInstance.Write(scratch, Result); 
02701                         } 
02702                 } 
02703  
02704                 void Write(const char_t* data, size_t length) 
02705                 { 
02706                         if (bufsize + length > bufcapacity) 
02707                         { 
02708                                 // flush the remaining buffer contents 
02709                                 flush(); 
02710  
02711                                 // handle large chunks 
02712                                 if (length > bufcapacity) 
02713                                 { 
02714                                         if (DocumentEncoding == GetWrite_native_DocumentEncoding()) 
02715                                         { 
02716                                                 // fast Path, can just Write data chunk 
02717                                                 WriterInstance.Write(data, length * sizeof(char_t)); 
02718                                                 return; 
02719                                         } 
02720  
02721                                         // need to convert in suitable chunks 
02722                                         while (length > bufcapacity) 
02723                                         { 
02724                                                 // get chunk size by selecting such number of characters that are guaranteed to fit into scratch buffer 
02725                                                 // and form a complete codepoint sequence (i.e. discard start of last codepoint if necessary) 
02726                                                 size_t chunk_size = GetValid_length(data, bufcapacity); 
02727  
02728                                                 // convert chunk and Write 
02729                                                 flush(data, chunk_size); 
02730  
02731                                                 // iterate 
02732                                                 data += chunk_size; 
02733                                                 length -= chunk_size; 
02734                                         } 
02735  
02736                                         // small tail is copied below 
02737                                         bufsize = 0; 
02738                                 } 
02739                         } 
02740  
02741                         memcpy(buffer + bufsize, data, length * sizeof(char_t)); 
02742                         bufsize += length; 
02743                 } 
02744  
02745                 void Write(const char_t* data) 
02746                 { 
02747                         Write(data, strlength(data)); 
02748                 } 
02749  
02750                 void Write(char_t d0) 
02751                 { 
02752                         if (bufsize + 1 > bufcapacity) flush(); 
02753  
02754                         buffer[bufsize + 0] = d0; 
02755                         bufsize += 1; 
02756                 } 
02757  
02758                 void Write(char_t d0, char_t d1) 
02759                 { 
02760                         if (bufsize + 2 > bufcapacity) flush(); 
02761  
02762                         buffer[bufsize + 0] = d0; 
02763                         buffer[bufsize + 1] = d1; 
02764                         bufsize += 2; 
02765                 } 
02766  
02767                 void Write(char_t d0, char_t d1, char_t d2) 
02768                 { 
02769                         if (bufsize + 3 > bufcapacity) flush(); 
02770  
02771                         buffer[bufsize + 0] = d0; 
02772                         buffer[bufsize + 1] = d1; 
02773                         buffer[bufsize + 2] = d2; 
02774                         bufsize += 3; 
02775                 } 
02776  
02777                 void Write(char_t d0, char_t d1, char_t d2, char_t d3) 
02778                 { 
02779                         if (bufsize + 4 > bufcapacity) flush(); 
02780  
02781                         buffer[bufsize + 0] = d0; 
02782                         buffer[bufsize + 1] = d1; 
02783                         buffer[bufsize + 2] = d2; 
02784                         buffer[bufsize + 3] = d3; 
02785                         bufsize += 4; 
02786                 } 
02787  
02788                 void Write(char_t d0, char_t d1, char_t d2, char_t d3, char_t d4) 
02789                 { 
02790                         if (bufsize + 5 > bufcapacity) flush(); 
02791  
02792                         buffer[bufsize + 0] = d0; 
02793                         buffer[bufsize + 1] = d1; 
02794                         buffer[bufsize + 2] = d2; 
02795                         buffer[bufsize + 3] = d3; 
02796                         buffer[bufsize + 4] = d4; 
02797                         bufsize += 5; 
02798                 } 
02799  
02800                 void Write(char_t d0, char_t d1, char_t d2, char_t d3, char_t d4, char_t d5) 
02801                 { 
02802                         if (bufsize + 6 > bufcapacity) flush(); 
02803  
02804                         buffer[bufsize + 0] = d0; 
02805                         buffer[bufsize + 1] = d1; 
02806                         buffer[bufsize + 2] = d2; 
02807                         buffer[bufsize + 3] = d3; 
02808                         buffer[bufsize + 4] = d4; 
02809                         buffer[bufsize + 5] = d5; 
02810                         bufsize += 6; 
02811                 } 
02812  
02813                 // utf8 maximum expansion: x4 (-> utf32) 
02814                 // utf16 maximum expansion: x2 (-> utf32) 
02815                 // utf32 maximum expansion: x1 
02816                 enum { bufcapacity = 2048 }; 
02817  
02818                 char_t buffer[bufcapacity]; 
02819                 char scratch[4 * bufcapacity]; 
02820  
02821                 Writer& WriterInstance; 
02822                 size_t bufsize; 
02823                 Encoding DocumentEncoding; 
02824         }; 
02825  
02826         void Write_bom(Writer& WriterInstance, Encoding DocumentEncoding) 
02827         { 
02828                 switch (DocumentEncoding) 
02829                 { 
02830                 case EncodingUTF8: 
02831                         WriterInstance.Write("\xef\xbb\xbf", 3); 
02832                         break; 
02833  
02834                 case EncodingUTF16BE: 
02835                         WriterInstance.Write("\xfe\xff", 2); 
02836                         break; 
02837  
02838                 case EncodingUTF16LE: 
02839                         WriterInstance.Write("\xff\xfe", 2); 
02840                         break; 
02841  
02842                 case EncodingUTF32BE: 
02843                         WriterInstance.Write("\x00\x00\xfe\xff", 4); 
02844                         break; 
02845  
02846                 case EncodingUTF32LE: 
02847                         WriterInstance.Write("\xff\xfe\x00\x00", 4); 
02848                         break; 
02849  
02850                 default: 
02851                         assert(!"Invalid DocumentEncoding"); 
02852                 } 
02853         } 
02854  
02855         void text_output_escaped(BufferedWriter& WriterInstance, const char_t* s, charTypex_t Type) 
02856         { 
02857                 while (*s) 
02858                 { 
02859                         const char_t* prev = s; 
02860                          
02861                         // While *s is a usual symbol 
02862                         while (!IS_CHARTYPEX(*s, Type)) ++s; 
02863                  
02864                         WriterInstance.Write(prev, static_cast<size_t>(s - prev)); 
02865  
02866                         switch (*s) 
02867                         { 
02868                                 case 0: break; 
02869                                 case '&': 
02870                                         WriterInstance.Write('&', 'a', 'm', 'p', ';'); 
02871                                         ++s; 
02872                                         break; 
02873                                 case '<': 
02874                                         WriterInstance.Write('&', 'l', 't', ';'); 
02875                                         ++s; 
02876                                         break; 
02877                                 case '>': 
02878                                         WriterInstance.Write('&', 'g', 't', ';'); 
02879                                         ++s; 
02880                                         break; 
02881                                 case '"': 
02882                                         WriterInstance.Write('&', 'q', 'u', 'o', 't', ';'); 
02883                                         ++s; 
02884                                         break; 
02885                                 default: // s is not a usual symbol 
02886                                 { 
02887                                         unsigned int ch = static_cast<unsigned int>(*s++); 
02888                                         assert(ch < 32); 
02889  
02890                                         WriterInstance.Write('&', '#', static_cast<char_t>((ch / 10) + '0'), static_cast<char_t>((ch % 10) + '0'), ';'); 
02891                                 } 
02892                         } 
02893                 } 
02894         } 
02895  
02896         void text_output_cdata(BufferedWriter& WriterInstance, const char_t* s) 
02897         { 
02898                 do 
02899                 { 
02900                         WriterInstance.Write('<', '!', '[', 'C', 'D'); 
02901                         WriterInstance.Write('A', 'T', 'A', '['); 
02902  
02903                         const char_t* prev = s; 
02904  
02905                         // look for ]]> sequence - we can't output it as is since it terminates CDATA 
02906                         while (*s && !(s[0] == ']' && s[1] == ']' && s[2] == '>')) ++s; 
02907  
02908                         // skip ]] if we stopped at ]]>, > will go to the next CDATA section 
02909                         if (*s) s += 2; 
02910  
02911                         WriterInstance.Write(prev, static_cast<size_t>(s - prev)); 
02912  
02913                         WriterInstance.Write(']', ']', '>'); 
02914                 } 
02915                 while (*s); 
02916         } 
02917  
02918         void NodeOutput_attributes(BufferedWriter& WriterInstance, const Node& node) 
02919         { 
02920                 const char_t* default_Name = XML_TEXT(":anonymous"); 
02921  
02922                 for (Attribute a = node.GetFirstAttribute(); a; a = a.GetNextAttribute()) 
02923                 { 
02924                         WriterInstance.Write(' '); 
02925                         WriterInstance.Write(a.Name()[0] ? a.Name() : default_Name); 
02926                         WriterInstance.Write('=', '"'); 
02927  
02928                         text_output_escaped(WriterInstance, a.Value(), ctx_special_attr); 
02929  
02930                         WriterInstance.Write('"'); 
02931                 } 
02932         } 
02933  
02934         void NodeOutput(BufferedWriter& WriterInstance, const Node& node, const char_t* indent, unsigned int flags, unsigned int Depth) 
02935         { 
02936                 const char_t* default_Name = XML_TEXT(":anonymous"); 
02937  
02938                 if ((flags & FormatIndent) != 0 && (flags & FormatRaw) == 0) 
02939                         for (unsigned int i = 0; i < Depth; ++i) WriterInstance.Write(indent); 
02940  
02941                 switch (node.Type()) 
02942                 { 
02943                 case NodeDocument: 
02944                 { 
02945                         for (Node n = node.GetFirstChild(); n; n = n.GetNextSibling()) 
02946                                 NodeOutput(WriterInstance, n, indent, flags, Depth); 
02947                         break; 
02948                 } 
02949                          
02950                 case NodeElement: 
02951                 { 
02952                         const char_t* Name = node.Name()[0] ? node.Name() : default_Name; 
02953  
02954                         WriterInstance.Write('<'); 
02955                         WriterInstance.Write(Name); 
02956  
02957                         NodeOutput_attributes(WriterInstance, node); 
02958  
02959                         if (flags & FormatRaw) 
02960                         { 
02961                                 if (!node.GetFirstChild()) 
02962                                         WriterInstance.Write(' ', '/', '>'); 
02963                                 else 
02964                                 { 
02965                                         WriterInstance.Write('>'); 
02966  
02967                                         for (Node n = node.GetFirstChild(); n; n = n.GetNextSibling()) 
02968                                                 NodeOutput(WriterInstance, n, indent, flags, Depth + 1); 
02969  
02970                                         WriterInstance.Write('<', '/'); 
02971                                         WriterInstance.Write(Name); 
02972                                         WriterInstance.Write('>'); 
02973                                 } 
02974                         } 
02975                         else if (!node.GetFirstChild()) 
02976                                 WriterInstance.Write(' ', '/', '>', '\n'); 
02977                         else if (node.GetFirstChild() == node.GetLastChild() && (node.GetFirstChild().Type() == NodePcdata || node.GetFirstChild().Type() == NodeCdata)) 
02978                         { 
02979                                 WriterInstance.Write('>'); 
02980  
02981                                 if (node.GetFirstChild().Type() == NodePcdata) 
02982                                         text_output_escaped(WriterInstance, node.GetFirstChild().Value(), ctx_special_pcdata); 
02983                                 else 
02984                                         text_output_cdata(WriterInstance, node.GetFirstChild().Value()); 
02985  
02986                                 WriterInstance.Write('<', '/'); 
02987                                 WriterInstance.Write(Name); 
02988                                 WriterInstance.Write('>', '\n'); 
02989                         } 
02990                         else 
02991                         { 
02992                                 WriterInstance.Write('>', '\n'); 
02993                                  
02994                                 for (Node n = node.GetFirstChild(); n; n = n.GetNextSibling()) 
02995                                         NodeOutput(WriterInstance, n, indent, flags, Depth + 1); 
02996  
02997                                 if ((flags & FormatIndent) != 0 && (flags & FormatRaw) == 0) 
02998                                         for (unsigned int i = 0; i < Depth; ++i) WriterInstance.Write(indent); 
02999                                  
03000                                 WriterInstance.Write('<', '/'); 
03001                                 WriterInstance.Write(Name); 
03002                                 WriterInstance.Write('>', '\n'); 
03003                         } 
03004  
03005                         break; 
03006                 } 
03007                  
03008                 case NodePcdata: 
03009                         text_output_escaped(WriterInstance, node.Value(), ctx_special_pcdata); 
03010                         if ((flags & FormatRaw) == 0) WriterInstance.Write('\n'); 
03011                         break; 
03012  
03013                 case NodeCdata: 
03014                         text_output_cdata(WriterInstance, node.Value()); 
03015                         if ((flags & FormatRaw) == 0) WriterInstance.Write('\n'); 
03016                         break; 
03017  
03018                 case NodeComment: 
03019                         WriterInstance.Write('<', '!', '-', '-'); 
03020                         WriterInstance.Write(node.Value()); 
03021                         WriterInstance.Write('-', '-', '>'); 
03022                         if ((flags & FormatRaw) == 0) WriterInstance.Write('\n'); 
03023                         break; 
03024  
03025                 case NodePi: 
03026                 case NodeDeclaration: 
03027                         WriterInstance.Write('<', '?'); 
03028                         WriterInstance.Write(node.Name()[0] ? node.Name() : default_Name); 
03029  
03030                         if (node.Type() == NodeDeclaration) 
03031                         { 
03032                                 NodeOutput_attributes(WriterInstance, node); 
03033                         } 
03034                         else if (node.Value()[0]) 
03035                         { 
03036                                 WriterInstance.Write(' '); 
03037                                 WriterInstance.Write(node.Value()); 
03038                         } 
03039  
03040                         WriterInstance.Write('?', '>'); 
03041                         if ((flags & FormatRaw) == 0) WriterInstance.Write('\n'); 
03042                         break; 
03043  
03044                 case NodeDocType: 
03045                         WriterInstance.Write('<', '!', 'D', 'O', 'C'); 
03046                         WriterInstance.Write('T', 'Y', 'P', 'E'); 
03047  
03048                         if (node.Value()[0]) 
03049                         { 
03050                                 WriterInstance.Write(' '); 
03051                                 WriterInstance.Write(node.Value()); 
03052                         } 
03053  
03054                         WriterInstance.Write('>'); 
03055                         if ((flags & FormatRaw) == 0) WriterInstance.Write('\n'); 
03056                         break; 
03057  
03058                 default: 
03059                         assert(!"Invalid node Type"); 
03060                 } 
03061         } 
03062  
03063         inline bool hAsDeclaration(const Node& node) 
03064         { 
03065                 for (Node GetChild = node.GetFirstChild(); GetChild; GetChild = GetChild.GetNextSibling()) 
03066                 { 
03067                         NodeType Type = GetChild.Type(); 
03068  
03069                         if (Type == NodeDeclaration) return true; 
03070                         if (Type == NodeElement) return false; 
03071                 } 
03072  
03073                 return false; 
03074         } 
03075  
03076         inline bool allow_InsertChild(NodeType GetParent, NodeType GetChild) 
03077         { 
03078                 if (GetParent != NodeDocument && GetParent != NodeElement) return false; 
03079                 if (GetChild == NodeDocument || GetChild == NodeNull) return false; 
03080                 if (GetParent != NodeDocument && (GetChild == NodeDeclaration || GetChild == NodeDocType)) return false; 
03081  
03082                 return true; 
03083         } 
03084  
03085         void recursive_copy_skip(Node& dest, const Node& source, const Node& skip) 
03086         { 
03087                 assert(dest.Type() == source.Type()); 
03088  
03089                 switch (source.Type()) 
03090                 { 
03091                 case NodeElement: 
03092                 { 
03093                         dest.SetName(source.Name()); 
03094  
03095                         for (Attribute a = source.GetFirstAttribute(); a; a = a.GetNextAttribute()) 
03096                                 dest.AppendAttribute(a.Name()).SetValue(a.Value()); 
03097  
03098                         for (Node c = source.GetFirstChild(); c; c = c.GetNextSibling()) 
03099                         { 
03100                                 if (c == skip) continue; 
03101  
03102                                 Node cc = dest.AppendChild(c.Type()); 
03103                                 assert(cc); 
03104  
03105                                 recursive_copy_skip(cc, c, skip); 
03106                         } 
03107  
03108                         break; 
03109                 } 
03110  
03111                 case NodePcdata: 
03112                 case NodeCdata: 
03113                 case NodeComment: 
03114                 case NodeDocType: 
03115                         dest.SetValue(source.Value()); 
03116                         break; 
03117  
03118                 case NodePi: 
03119                         dest.SetName(source.Name()); 
03120                         dest.SetValue(source.Value()); 
03121                         break; 
03122  
03123                 case NodeDeclaration: 
03124                 { 
03125                         dest.SetName(source.Name()); 
03126  
03127                         for (Attribute a = source.GetFirstAttribute(); a; a = a.GetNextAttribute()) 
03128                                 dest.AppendAttribute(a.Name()).SetValue(a.Value()); 
03129  
03130                         break; 
03131                 } 
03132  
03133                 default: 
03134                         assert(!"Invalid node Type"); 
03135                 } 
03136         } 
03137  
03138         // we need to get length of entire file to Load it in memory; the only (relatively) sane way to do it is via seek/tell trick 
03139         ParseStatus GetFile_size(FILE* file, size_t& out_Result) 
03140         { 
03141         #if defined(_MSC_VER) && _MSC_VER >= 1400 
03142                 // there are 64-bit versions of fseek/ftell, let's use them 
03143                 typedef __int64 length_type; 
03144  
03145                 _fseeki64(file, 0, SEEK_END); 
03146                 length_type length = _ftelli64(file); 
03147                 _fseeki64(file, 0, SEEK_SET); 
03148         #elif defined(__MINGW32__) && !defined(__NO_MINGW_LFS) && !defined(__STRICT_ANSI__) 
03149                 // there are 64-bit versions of fseek/ftell, let's use them 
03150                 typedef off64_t length_type; 
03151  
03152                 fseeko64(file, 0, SEEK_END); 
03153                 length_type length = ftello64(file); 
03154                 fseeko64(file, 0, SEEK_SET); 
03155         #else 
03156                 // if this is a 32-bit OS, long is enough; if this is a unix system, long is 64-bit, which is enough; otherwise we can't do anything anyway. 
03157                 typedef long length_type; 
03158  
03159                 fseek(file, 0, SEEK_END); 
03160                 length_type length = ftell(file); 
03161                 fseek(file, 0, SEEK_SET); 
03162         #endif 
03163  
03164                 // check for I/O errors 
03165                 if (length < 0) return StatusIOError; 
03166                  
03167                 // check for overflow 
03168                 size_t Result = static_cast<size_t>(length); 
03169  
03170                 if (static_cast<length_type>(Result) != length) return StatusOutOfMemory; 
03171  
03172                 // finalize 
03173                 out_Result = Result; 
03174  
03175                 return StatusOk; 
03176         } 
03177  
03178         ParseResult LoadFileImpl(Document& doc, FILE* file, unsigned int options, Encoding DocumentEncoding) 
03179         { 
03180                 if (!file) return make_ParseResult(StatusFileNotFound); 
03181  
03182                 // get file size (can Result in I/O errors) 
03183                 size_t size = 0; 
03184                 ParseStatus size_Status = GetFile_size(file, size); 
03185  
03186                 if (size_Status != StatusOk) 
03187                 { 
03188                         fclose(file); 
03189                         return make_ParseResult(size_Status); 
03190                 } 
03191                  
03192                 // allocate buffer for the whole file 
03193                 char* contents = static_cast<char*>(global_allocate(size > 0 ? size : 1)); 
03194  
03195                 if (!contents) 
03196                 { 
03197                         fclose(file); 
03198                         return make_ParseResult(StatusOutOfMemory); 
03199                 } 
03200  
03201                 // read file in memory
