05182                         return Result; 
05183                 } 
05184  
05185                 void* reallocate(void* ptr, size_t old_size, size_t new_size) 
05186                 { 
05187                         // align size so that we're able to store pointers in subsequent blocks 
05188                         old_size = (old_size + sizeof(void*) - 1) & ~(sizeof(void*) - 1); 
05189                         new_size = (new_size + sizeof(void*) - 1) & ~(sizeof(void*) - 1); 
05190  
05191                         // we can only reallocate the last object 
05192                         assert(ptr == 0 || static_cast<char*>(ptr) + old_size == _GetRoot->data + _GetRoot_size); 
05193  
05194                         // adjust GetRoot size so that we have not allocated the object at all 
05195                         bool only_object = (_GetRoot_size == old_size); 
05196  
05197                         if (ptr) _GetRoot_size -= old_size; 
05198  
05199                         // allocate a new version (this will obviously reuse the memory if possible) 
05200                         void* Result = allocate(new_size); 
05201                         assert(Result); 
05202  
05203                         // we have a new block 
05204                         if (Result != ptr && ptr) 
05205                         { 
05206                                 // copy old data 
05207                                 assert(new_size > old_size); 
05208                                 memcpy(Result, ptr, old_size); 
05209  
05210                                 // free the previous page if it had no other objects 
05211                                 if (only_object) 
05212                                 { 
05213                                         assert(_GetRoot->data == Result); 
05214                                         assert(_GetRoot->next); 
05215  
05216                                         XPathMemoryBlock* next = _GetRoot->next->next; 
05217  
05218                                         if (next) 
05219                                         { 
05220                                                 // deallocate the whole page, unless it was the first one 
05221                                                 global_deallocate(_GetRoot->next); 
05222                                                 _GetRoot->next = next; 
05223                                         } 
05224                                 } 
05225                         } 
05226  
05227                         return Result; 
05228                 } 
05229  
05230                 void revert(const XPathAllocator& state) 
05231                 { 
05232                         // free all new pages 
05233                         XPathMemoryBlock* cur = _GetRoot; 
05234  
05235                         while (cur != state._GetRoot) 
05236                         { 
05237                                 XPathMemoryBlock* next = cur->next; 
05238  
05239                                 global_deallocate(cur); 
05240  
05241                                 cur = next; 
05242                         } 
05243  
05244                         // restore state 
05245                         _GetRoot = state._GetRoot; 
05246                         _GetRoot_size = state._GetRoot_size; 
05247                 } 
05248  
05249                 void release() 
05250                 { 
05251                         XPathMemoryBlock* cur = _GetRoot; 
05252                         assert(cur); 
05253  
05254                         while (cur->next) 
05255                         { 
05256                                 XPathMemoryBlock* next = cur->next; 
05257  
05258                                 global_deallocate(cur); 
05259  
05260                                 cur = next; 
05261                         } 
05262                 } 
05263         }; 
05264  
05265         struct XPathAllocatorCapture 
05266         { 
05267                 XPathAllocatorCapture(XPathAllocator* alloc): _target(alloc), _state(*alloc) 
05268                 { 
05269                 } 
05270  
05271                 ~XPathAllocatorCapture() 
05272                 { 
05273                         _target->revert(_state); 
05274                 } 
05275  
05276                 XPathAllocator* _target; 
05277                 XPathAllocator _state; 
05278         }; 
05279  
05280         struct XPathStack 
05281         { 
05282                 XPathAllocator* Result; 
05283                 XPathAllocator* temp; 
05284         }; 
05285  
05286         struct XPathStackData 
05287         { 
05288                 XPathMemoryBlock blocks[2]; 
05289                 XPathAllocator Result; 
05290                 XPathAllocator temp; 
05291                 XPathStack stack; 
05292  
05293         #ifdef XML_NO_EXCEPTIONS 
05294                 jmp_buf error_handler; 
05295         #endif 
05296  
05297                 XPathStackData(): Result(blocks + 0), temp(blocks + 1) 
05298                 { 
05299                         blocks[0].next = blocks[1].next = 0; 
05300  
05301                         stack.Result = &Result; 
05302                         stack.temp = &temp; 
05303  
05304                 #ifdef XML_NO_EXCEPTIONS 
05305                         Result.error_handler = temp.error_handler = &error_handler; 
05306                 #endif 
05307                 } 
05308  
05309                 ~XPathStackData() 
05310                 { 
05311                         Result.release(); 
05312                         temp.release(); 
05313                 } 
05314         }; 
05315 } 
05316  
05317 // String class 
05318 namespace 
05319 { 
05320         class XPathString 
05321         { 
05322                 const char_t* _buffer; 
05323                 bool _uses_heap; 
05324  
05325                 static char_t* duplicate_string(const char_t* string, size_t length, XPathAllocator* alloc) 
05326                 { 
05327                         char_t* Result = static_cast<char_t*>(alloc->allocate((length + 1) * sizeof(char_t))); 
05328                         assert(Result); 
05329  
05330                         memcpy(Result, string, length * sizeof(char_t)); 
05331                         Result[length] = 0; 
05332  
05333                         return Result; 
05334                 } 
05335  
05336                 static char_t* duplicate_string(const char_t* string, XPathAllocator* alloc) 
05337                 { 
05338                         return duplicate_string(string, strlength(string), alloc); 
05339                 } 
05340  
05341         public: 
05342                 XPathString(): _buffer(XML_TEXT("")), _uses_heap(false) 
05343                 { 
05344                 } 
05345  
05346                 explicit XPathString(const char_t* str, XPathAllocator* alloc) 
05347                 { 
05348                         bool empty = (*str == 0); 
05349  
05350                         _buffer = empty ? XML_TEXT("") : duplicate_string(str, alloc); 
05351                         _uses_heap = !empty; 
05352                 } 
05353  
05354                 explicit XPathString(const char_t* str, bool use_heap): _buffer(str), _uses_heap(use_heap) 
05355                 { 
05356                 } 
05357  
05358                 XPathString(const char_t* begin, const char_t* end, XPathAllocator* alloc) 
05359                 { 
05360                         assert(begin <= end); 
05361  
05362                         bool empty = (begin == end); 
05363  
05364                         _buffer = empty ? XML_TEXT("") : duplicate_string(begin, static_cast<size_t>(end - begin), alloc); 
05365                         _uses_heap = !empty; 
05366                 } 
05367  
05368                 void append(const XPathString& o, XPathAllocator* alloc) 
05369                 { 
05370                         // skip empty sources 
05371                         if (!*o._buffer) return; 
05372  
05373                         // fast append for constant empty target and constant source 
05374                         if (!*_buffer && !_uses_heap && !o._uses_heap) 
05375                         { 
05376                                 _buffer = o._buffer; 
05377                         } 
05378                         else 
05379                         { 
05380                                 // need to make heap copy 
05381                                 size_t tarGetLength = strlength(_buffer); 
05382                                 size_t source_length = strlength(o._buffer); 
05383                                 size_t length = tarGetLength + source_length; 
05384  
05385                                 // allocate new buffer 
05386                                 char_t* Result = static_cast<char_t*>(alloc->reallocate(_uses_heap ? const_cast<char_t*>(_buffer) : 0, (tarGetLength + 1) * sizeof(char_t), (length + 1) * sizeof(char_t))); 
05387                                 assert(Result); 
05388  
05389                                 // append first string to the new buffer in case there was no reallocation 
05390                                 if (!_uses_heap) memcpy(Result, _buffer, tarGetLength * sizeof(char_t)); 
05391  
05392                                 // append second string to the new buffer 
05393                                 memcpy(Result + tarGetLength, o._buffer, source_length * sizeof(char_t)); 
05394                                 Result[length] = 0; 
05395  
05396                                 // finalize 
05397                                 _buffer = Result; 
05398                                 _uses_heap = true; 
05399                         } 
05400                 } 
05401  
05402                 const char_t* c_str() const 
05403                 { 
05404                         return _buffer; 
05405                 } 
05406  
05407                 size_t length() const 
05408                 { 
05409                         return strlength(_buffer); 
05410                 } 
05411                  
05412                 char_t* data(XPathAllocator* alloc) 
05413                 { 
05414                         // make private heap copy 
05415                         if (!_uses_heap) 
05416                         { 
05417                                 _buffer = duplicate_string(_buffer, alloc); 
05418                                 _uses_heap = true; 
05419                         } 
05420  
05421                         return const_cast<char_t*>(_buffer); 
05422                 } 
05423  
05424                 bool Empty() const 
05425                 { 
05426                         return *_buffer == 0; 
05427                 } 
05428  
05429                 bool operator==(const XPathString& o) const 
05430                 { 
05431                         return strequal(_buffer, o._buffer); 
05432                 } 
05433  
05434                 bool operator!=(const XPathString& o) const 
05435                 { 
05436                         return !strequal(_buffer, o._buffer); 
05437                 } 
05438  
05439                 bool uses_heap() const 
05440                 { 
05441                         return _uses_heap; 
05442                 } 
05443         }; 
05444  
05445         XPathString XPathStringConst(const char_t* str) 
05446         { 
05447                 return XPathString(str, false); 
05448         } 
05449 } 
05450  
05451 namespace 
05452 { 
05453         bool starts_with(const char_t* string, const char_t* pattern) 
05454         { 
05455                 while (*pattern && *string == *pattern) 
05456                 { 
05457                         string++; 
05458                         pattern++; 
05459                 } 
05460  
05461                 return *pattern == 0; 
05462         } 
05463  
05464         const char_t* FindChar(const char_t* s, char_t c) 
05465         { 
05466         #ifdef XML_WCHAR_MODE 
05467                 return wcschr(s, c); 
05468         #else 
05469                 return strchr(s, c); 
05470         #endif 
05471         } 
05472  
05473         const char_t* FindSubstring(const char_t* s, const char_t* p) 
05474         { 
05475         #ifdef XML_WCHAR_MODE 
05476                 // MSVC6 wcsstr bug workaround (if s is empty it always returns 0) 
05477                 return (*p == 0) ? s : wcsstr(s, p); 
05478         #else 
05479                 return strstr(s, p); 
05480         #endif 
05481         } 
05482  
05483         // Converts symbol to lower case, if it is an ASCII one 
05484         char_t tolower_ascii(char_t ch) 
05485         { 
05486                 return static_cast<unsigned int>(ch - 'A') < 26 ? static_cast<char_t>(ch | ' ') : ch; 
05487         } 
05488  
05489         XPathString string_Value(const XPathNode& na, XPathAllocator* alloc) 
05490         { 
05491                 if (na.GetAttribute()) 
05492                         return XPathStringConst(na.GetAttribute().Value()); 
05493                 else 
05494                 { 
05495                         const Node& n = na.GetNode(); 
05496  
05497                         switch (n.Type()) 
05498                         { 
05499                         case NodePcdata: 
05500                         case NodeCdata: 
05501                         case NodeComment: 
05502                         case NodePi: 
05503                                 return XPathStringConst(n.Value()); 
05504                          
05505                         case NodeDocument: 
05506                         case NodeElement: 
05507                         { 
05508                                 XPathString Result; 
05509  
05510                                 Node cur = n.GetFirstChild(); 
05511                                  
05512                                 while (cur && cur != n) 
05513                                 { 
05514                                         if (cur.Type() == NodePcdata || cur.Type() == NodeCdata) 
05515                                                 Result.append(XPathStringConst(cur.Value()), alloc); 
05516  
05517                                         if (cur.GetFirstChild()) 
05518                                                 cur = cur.GetFirstChild(); 
05519                                         else if (cur.GetNextSibling()) 
05520                                                 cur = cur.GetNextSibling(); 
05521                                         else 
05522                                         { 
05523                                                 while (!cur.GetNextSibling() && cur != n) 
05524                                                         cur = cur.GetParent(); 
05525  
05526                                                 if (cur != n) cur = cur.GetNextSibling(); 
05527                                         } 
05528                                 } 
05529                                  
05530                                 return Result; 
05531                         } 
05532                          
05533                         default: 
05534                                 return XPathString(); 
05535                         } 
05536                 } 
05537         } 
05538          
05539         unsigned int NodeHeight(Node n) 
05540         { 
05541                 unsigned int Result = 0; 
05542                  
05543                 while (n) 
05544                 { 
05545                         ++Result; 
05546                         n = n.GetParent(); 
05547                 } 
05548                  
05549                 return Result; 
05550         } 
05551          
05552         bool NodeIs_before(Node ln, unsigned int lh, Node rn, unsigned int rh) 
05553         { 
05554                 // normalize heights 
05555                 for (unsigned int i = rh; i < lh; i++) ln = ln.GetParent(); 
05556                 for (unsigned int j = lh; j < rh; j++) rn = rn.GetParent(); 
05557                  
05558                 // one node is the ancestor of the other 
05559                 if (ln == rn) return lh < rh; 
05560                  
05561                 // find common ancestor 
05562                 while (ln.GetParent() != rn.GetParent()) 
05563                 { 
05564                         ln = ln.GetParent(); 
05565                         rn = rn.GetParent(); 
05566                 } 
05567  
05568                 // there is no common ancestor (the shared GetParent is null), nodes are from different documents 
05569                 if (!ln.GetParent()) return ln < rn; 
05570  
05571                 // determine sibling order 
05572                 for (; ln; ln = ln.GetNextSibling()) 
05573                         if (ln == rn) 
05574                                 return true; 
05575                                  
05576                 return false; 
05577         } 
05578  
05579         bool NodeIs_ancestor(Node GetParent, Node node) 
05580         { 
05581                 while (node && node != GetParent) node = node.GetParent(); 
05582  
05583                 return GetParent && node == GetParent; 
05584         } 
05585  
05586         const void* document_order(const XPathNode& xnode) 
05587         { 
05588                 NodeStruct* node = xnode.GetNode().InternalObject(); 
05589  
05590                 if (node) 
05591                 { 
05592                         if (node->Name && (node->header & MemoryPage_Name_allocated_mask) == 0) return node->Name; 
05593                         if (node->Value && (node->header & MemoryPage_Value_allocated_mask) == 0) return node->Value; 
05594                         return 0; 
05595                 } 
05596  
05597                 AttributeStruct* attr = xnode.GetAttribute().InternalObject(); 
05598  
05599                 if (attr) 
05600                 { 
05601                         if ((attr->header & MemoryPage_Name_allocated_mask) == 0) return attr->Name; 
05602                         if ((attr->header & MemoryPage_Value_allocated_mask) == 0) return attr->Value; 
05603                         return 0; 
05604                 } 
05605  
05606                 return 0; 
05607         } 
05608          
05609         struct document_order_comparator 
05610         { 
05611                 bool operator()(const XPathNode& lhs, const XPathNode& rhs) const 
05612                 { 
05613                         // optimized document order based check 
05614                         const void* lo = document_order(lhs); 
05615                         const void* ro = document_order(rhs); 
05616  
05617                         if (lo && ro) return lo < ro; 
05618  
05619                         // slow comparison 
05620                         Node ln = lhs.GetNode(), rn = rhs.GetNode(); 
05621  
05622                         // compare attributes 
05623                         if (lhs.GetAttribute() && rhs.GetAttribute()) 
05624                         { 
05625                                 // shared GetParent 
05626                                 if (lhs.GetParent() == rhs.GetParent()) 
05627                                 { 
05628                                         // determine sibling order 
05629                                         for (Attribute a = lhs.GetAttribute(); a; a = a.GetNextAttribute()) 
05630                                                 if (a == rhs.GetAttribute()) 
05631                                                         return true; 
05632                                          
05633                                         return false; 
05634                                 } 
05635                                  
05636                                 // compare GetAttribute GetParents 
05637                                 ln = lhs.GetParent(); 
05638                                 rn = rhs.GetParent(); 
05639                         } 
05640                         else if (lhs.GetAttribute()) 
05641                         { 
05642                                 // attributes go after the GetParent element 
05643                                 if (lhs.GetParent() == rhs.GetNode()) return false; 
05644                                  
05645                                 ln = lhs.GetParent(); 
05646                         } 
05647                         else if (rhs.GetAttribute()) 
05648                         { 
05649                                 // attributes go after the GetParent element 
05650                                 if (rhs.GetParent() == lhs.GetNode()) return true; 
05651                                  
05652                                 rn = rhs.GetParent(); 
05653                         } 
05654  
05655                         if (ln == rn) return false; 
05656                          
05657                         unsigned int lh = NodeHeight(ln); 
05658                         unsigned int rh = NodeHeight(rn); 
05659                          
05660                         return NodeIs_before(ln, lh, rn, rh); 
05661                 } 
05662         }; 
05663  
05664         struct duplicate_comparator 
05665         { 
05666                 bool operator()(const XPathNode& lhs, const XPathNode& rhs) const 
05667                 { 
05668                         if (lhs.GetAttribute()) return rhs.GetAttribute() ? lhs.GetAttribute() < rhs.GetAttribute() : true; 
05669                         else return rhs.GetAttribute() ? false : lhs.GetNode() < rhs.GetNode(); 
05670                 } 
05671         }; 
05672          
05673         double gen_nan() 
05674         { 
05675         #if defined(__STDC_IEC_559__) || ((FLT_RADIX - 0 == 2) && (FLT_MAX_EXP - 0 == 128) && (FLT_MANT_DIG - 0 == 24)) 
05676                 union { float f; int32_t i; } u[sizeof(float) == sizeof(int32_t) ? 1 : -1]; 
05677                 u[0].i = 0x7fc00000; 
05678                 return u[0].f; 
05679         #else 
05680                 // fallback 
05681                 const volatile double zero = 0.0; 
05682                 return zero / zero; 
05683         #endif 
05684         } 
05685          
05686         bool is_nan(double Value) 
05687         { 
05688         #if defined(_MSC_VER) || defined(__BORLANDC__) 
05689                 return !!_isnan(Value); 
05690         #elif defined(fpclassify) && defined(FP_NAN) 
05691                 return fpclassify(Value) == FP_NAN; 
05692         #else 
05693                 // fallback 
05694                 const volatile double v = Value; 
05695                 return v != v; 
05696         #endif 
05697         } 
05698          
05699         const char_t* convert_number_to_string_special(double Value) 
05700         { 
05701         #if defined(_MSC_VER) || defined(__BORLANDC__) 
05702                 if (_finite(Value)) return (Value == 0) ? XML_TEXT("0") : 0; 
05703                 if (_isnan(Value)) return XML_TEXT("NaN"); 
05704                 return XML_TEXT("-Infinity") + (Value > 0); 
05705         #elif defined(fpclassify) && defined(FP_NAN) && defined(FP_INFINITE) && defined(FP_ZERO) 
05706                 switch (fpclassify(Value)) 
05707                 { 
05708                 case FP_NAN: 
05709                         return XML_TEXT("NaN"); 
05710  
05711                 case FP_INFINITE: 
05712                         return XML_TEXT("-Infinity") + (Value > 0); 
05713  
05714                 case FP_ZERO: 
05715                         return XML_TEXT("0"); 
05716  
05717                 default: 
05718                         return 0; 
05719                 } 
05720         #else 
05721                 // fallback 
05722                 const volatile double v = Value; 
05723  
05724                 if (v == 0) return XML_TEXT("0"); 
05725                 if (v != v) return XML_TEXT("NaN"); 
05726                 if (v * 2 == v) return XML_TEXT("-Infinity") + (Value > 0); 
05727                 return 0; 
05728         #endif 
05729         } 
05730          
05731         bool convert_number_to_boolean(double Value) 
05732         { 
05733                 return (Value != 0 && !is_nan(Value)); 
05734         } 
05735          
05736         void truncate_zeros(char* begin, char* end) 
05737         { 
05738                 while (begin != end && end[-1] == '0') end--; 
05739  
05740                 *end = 0; 
05741         } 
05742  
05743         // gets mantissa digits in the form of 0.xxxxx with 0. implied and the exponent 
05744 #if defined(_MSC_VER) && _MSC_VER >= 1400 
05745         void convert_number_to_mantissa_exponent(double Value, char* buffer, size_t buffer_size, char** out_mantissa, int* out_exponent) 
05746         { 
05747                 // get base Values 
05748                 int sign, exponent; 
05749                 _ecvt_s(buffer, buffer_size, Value, DBL_DIG + 1, &exponent, &sign); 
05750  
05751                 // truncate redundant zeros 
05752                 truncate_zeros(buffer, buffer + strlen(buffer)); 
05753  
05754                 // fill Results 
05755                 *out_mantissa = buffer; 
05756                 *out_exponent = exponent; 
05757         } 
05758 #else 
05759         void convert_number_to_mantissa_exponent(double Value, char* buffer, size_t buffer_size, char** out_mantissa, int* out_exponent) 
05760         { 
05761                 // get a scientific notation Value with IEEE DBL_DIG decimals 
05762                 sprintf(buffer, "%.*e", DBL_DIG, Value); 
05763                 assert(strlen(buffer) < buffer_size); 
05764                 (void)!buffer_size; 
05765  
05766                 // get the exponent (possibly negative) 
05767                 char* exponent_string = strchr(buffer, 'e'); 
05768                 assert(exponent_string); 
05769  
05770                 int exponent = atoi(exponent_string + 1); 
05771  
05772                 // extract mantissa string: skip sign 
05773                 char* mantissa = buffer[0] == '-' ? buffer + 1 : buffer; 
05774                 assert(mantissa[0] != '0' && mantissa[1] == '.'); 
05775  
05776                 // divide mantissa by 10 to eliminate integer part 
05777                 mantissa[1] = mantissa[0]; 
05778                 mantissa++; 
05779                 exponent++; 
05780  
05781                 // remove extra mantissa digits and zero-terminate mantissa 
05782                 truncate_zeros(mantissa, exponent_string); 
05783  
05784                 // fill Results 
05785                 *out_mantissa = mantissa; 
05786                 *out_exponent = exponent; 
05787         } 
05788 #endif 
05789  
05790         XPathString convert_number_to_string(double Value, XPathAllocator* alloc) 
05791         { 
05792                 // try special number conversion 
05793                 const char_t* special = convert_number_to_string_special(Value); 
05794                 if (special) return XPathStringConst(special); 
05795  
05796                 // get mantissa + exponent form 
05797                 char mantissa_buffer[64]; 
05798  
05799                 char* mantissa; 
05800                 int exponent; 
05801                 convert_number_to_mantissa_exponent(Value, mantissa_buffer, sizeof(mantissa_buffer), &mantissa, &exponent); 
05802  
05803                 // make the number! 
05804                 char_t Result[512]; 
05805                 char_t* s = Result; 
05806  
05807                 // sign 
05808                 if (Value < 0) *s++ = '-'; 
05809  
05810                 // integer part 
05811                 if (exponent <= 0) 
05812                 { 
05813                         *s++ = '0'; 
05814                 } 
05815                 else 
05816                 { 
05817                         while (exponent > 0) 
05818                         { 
05819                                 assert(*mantissa == 0 || (unsigned)(*mantissa - '0') <= 9); 
05820                                 *s++ = *mantissa ? *mantissa++ : '0'; 
05821                                 exponent--; 
05822                         } 
05823                 } 
05824  
05825                 // fractional part 
05826                 if (*mantissa) 
05827                 { 
05828                         // decimal point 
05829                         *s++ = '.'; 
05830  
05831                         // extra zeroes from negative exponent 
05832                         while (exponent < 0) 
05833                         { 
05834                                 *s++ = '0'; 
05835                                 exponent++; 
05836                         } 
05837  
05838                         // extra mantissa digits 
05839                         while (*mantissa) 
05840                         { 
05841                                 assert((unsigned)(*mantissa - '0') <= 9); 
05842                                 *s++ = *mantissa++; 
05843                         } 
05844                 } 
05845  
05846                 // zero-terminate 
05847                 assert(s < Result + sizeof(Result) / sizeof(Result[0])); 
05848                 *s = 0; 
05849  
05850                 return XPathString(Result, alloc); 
05851         } 
05852          
05853         bool check_Stringo_number_format(const char_t* string) 
05854         { 
05855                 // parse leading whitespace 
05856                 while (IS_CHARTYPE(*string, ct_space)) ++string; 
05857  
05858                 // parse sign 
05859                 if (*string == '-') ++string; 
05860  
05861                 if (!*string) return false; 
05862  
05863                 // if there is no integer part, there should be a decimal part with at least one digit 
05864                 if (!IS_CHARTYPEX(string[0], ctx_digit) && (string[0] != '.' || !IS_CHARTYPEX(string[1], ctx_digit))) return false; 
05865  
05866                 // parse integer part 
05867                 while (IS_CHARTYPEX(*string, ctx_digit)) ++string; 
05868  
05869                 // parse decimal part 
05870                 if (*string == '.') 
05871                 { 
05872                         ++string; 
05873  
05874                         while (IS_CHARTYPEX(*string, ctx_digit)) ++string; 
05875                 } 
05876  
05877                 // parse trailing whitespace 
05878                 while (IS_CHARTYPE(*string, ct_space)) ++string; 
05879  
05880                 return *string == 0; 
05881         } 
05882  
05883         double convert_Stringo_number(const char_t* string) 
05884         { 
05885                 // check string format 
05886                 if (!check_Stringo_number_format(string)) return gen_nan(); 
05887  
05888                 // parse string 
05889         #ifdef XML_WCHAR_MODE 
05890                 return wcstod(string, 0); 
05891         #else 
05892                 return atof(string); 
05893         #endif 
05894         } 
05895  
05896         bool convert_Stringo_number(const char_t* begin, const char_t* end, double* out_Result) 
05897         { 
05898                 char_t buffer[32]; 
05899  
05900                 size_t length = static_cast<size_t>(end - begin); 
05901                 char_t* scratch = buffer; 
05902  
05903                 if (length >= sizeof(buffer) / sizeof(buffer[0])) 
05904                 { 
05905                         // need to make dummy on-heap copy 
05906                         scratch = static_cast<char_t*>(global_allocate((length + 1) * sizeof(char_t))); 
05907                         if (!scratch) return false; 
05908                 } 
05909  
05910                 // copy string to zero-terminated buffer and perform conversion 
05911                 memcpy(scratch, begin, length * sizeof(char_t)); 
05912                 scratch[length] = 0; 
05913  
05914                 *out_Result = convert_Stringo_number(scratch); 
05915  
05916                 // free dummy buffer 
05917                 if (scratch != buffer) global_deallocate(scratch); 
05918  
05919                 return true; 
05920         } 
05921          
05922         double round_nearest(double Value) 
05923         { 
05924                 return floor(Value + 0.5); 
05925         } 
05926  
05927         double round_nearest_nzero(double Value) 
05928         { 
05929                 // same as round_nearest, but returns -0 for [-0.5, -0] 
05930                 // ceil is used to differentiate between +0 and -0 (we return -0 for [-0.5, -0] and +0 for +0) 
05931                 return (Value >= -0.5 && Value <= 0) ? ceil(Value) : floor(Value + 0.5); 
05932         } 
05933          
05934         const char_t* qualified_Name(const XPathNode& node) 
05935         { 
05936                 return node.GetAttribute() ? node.GetAttribute().Name() : node.GetNode().Name(); 
05937         } 
05938          
05939         const char_t* local_Name(const XPathNode& node) 
05940         { 
05941                 const char_t* Name = qualified_Name(node); 
05942                 const char_t* p = FindChar(Name, ':'); 
05943                  
05944                 return p ? p + 1 : Name; 
05945         } 
05946  
05947         struct namespace_uri_predicate 
05948         { 
05949                 const char_t* prefix; 
05950                 size_t prefix_length; 
05951  
05952                 namespace_uri_predicate(const char_t* Name) 
05953                 { 
05954                         const char_t* pos = FindChar(Name, ':'); 
05955  
05956                         prefix = pos ? Name : 0; 
05957                         prefix_length = pos ? static_cast<size_t>(pos - Name) : 0; 
05958                 } 
05959  
05960                 bool operator()(const Attribute& a) const 
05961                 { 
05962                         const char_t* Name = a.Name(); 
05963  
05964                         if (!starts_with(Name, XML_TEXT("xmlns"))) return false; 
05965  
05966                         return prefix ? Name[5] == ':' && strequalrange(Name + 6, prefix, prefix_length) : Name[5] == 0; 
05967                 } 
05968         }; 
05969  
05970         const char_t* namespace_uri(const Node& node) 
05971         { 
05972                 namespace_uri_predicate pred = node.Name(); 
05973                  
05974                 Node p = node; 
05975                  
05976                 while (p) 
05977                 { 
05978                         Attribute a = p.FindAttribute(pred); 
05979                          
05980                         if (a) return a.Value(); 
05981                          
05982                         p = p.GetParent(); 
05983                 } 
05984                  
05985                 return XML_TEXT(""); 
05986         } 
05987  
05988         const char_t* namespace_uri(const Attribute& attr, const Node& GetParent) 
05989         { 
05990                 namespace_uri_predicate pred = attr.Name(); 
05991                  
05992                 // Default namespace does not apply to attributes 
05993                 if (!pred.prefix) return XML_TEXT(""); 
05994                  
05995                 Node p = GetParent; 
05996                  
05997                 while (p) 
05998                 { 
05999                         Attribute a = p.FindAttribute(pred); 
06000                          
06001                         if (a) return a.Value(); 
06002                          
06003                         p = p.GetParent(); 
06004                 } 
06005                  
06006                 return XML_TEXT(""); 
06007         } 
06008  
06009         const char_t* namespace_uri(const XPathNode& node) 
06010         { 
06011                 return node.GetAttribute() ? namespace_uri(node.GetAttribute(), node.GetParent()) : namespace_uri(node.GetNode()); 
06012         } 
06013  
06014         void normalize_space(char_t* buffer) 
06015         { 
06016                 char_t* Write = buffer; 
06017  
06018                 for (char_t* it = buffer; *it; ) 
06019                 { 
06020                         char_t ch = *it++; 
06021  
06022                         if (IS_CHARTYPE(ch, ct_space)) 
06023                         { 
06024                                 // replace whitespace sequence with single space 
06025                                 while (IS_CHARTYPE(*it, ct_space)) it++; 
06026  
06027                                 // avoid leading spaces 
06028                                 if (Write != buffer) *Write++ = ' '; 
06029                         } 
06030                         else *Write++ = ch; 
06031                 } 
06032  
06033                 // remove trailing space 
06034                 if (Write != buffer && IS_CHARTYPE(Write[-1], ct_space)) Write--; 
06035  
06036                 // zero-terminate 
06037                 *Write = 0; 
06038         } 
06039  
06040         void translate(char_t* buffer, const char_t* from, const char_t* to) 
06041         { 
06042                 size_t to_length = strlength(to); 
06043  
06044                 char_t* Write = buffer; 
06045  
06046                 while (*buffer) 
06047                 { 
06048                         DMC_VOLATILE char_t ch = *buffer++; 
06049  
06050                         const char_t* pos = FindChar(from, ch); 
06051  
06052                         if (!pos) 
06053                                 *Write++ = ch; // do not process 
06054                         else if (static_cast<size_t>(pos - from) < to_length) 
06055                                 *Write++ = to[pos - from]; // replace 
06056                 } 
06057  
06058                 // zero-terminate 
06059                 *Write = 0; 
06060         } 
06061  
06062         struct XPathVariableBoolean: XPathVariable 
06063         { 
06064                 XPathVariableBoolean(): Value(false) 
06065                 { 
06066                 } 
06067  
06068                 bool Value; 
06069                 char_t Name[1]; 
06070         }; 
06071  
06072         struct XPathVariableNumber: XPathVariable 
06073         { 
06074                 XPathVariableNumber(): Value(0) 
06075                 { 
06076                 } 
06077  
06078                 double Value; 
06079                 char_t Name[1]; 
06080         }; 
06081  
06082         struct XPathVariableString: XPathVariable 
06083         { 
06084                 XPathVariableString(): Value(0) 
06085                 { 
06086                 } 
06087  
06088                 ~XPathVariableString() 
06089                 { 
06090                         if (Value) global_deallocate(Value); 
06091                 } 
06092  
06093                 char_t* Value; 
06094                 char_t Name[1]; 
06095         }; 
06096  
06097         struct XPathVariableNodeSet: XPathVariable 
06098         { 
06099                 XPathNodeSet Value; 
06100                 char_t Name[1]; 
06101         }; 
06102  
06103         const XPathNodeSet dummy_NodeSet; 
06104  
06105         unsigned int hash_string(const char_t* str) 
06106         { 
06107                 // Jenkins one-at-a-time hash (http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jenkins_hash_function#one-at-a-time) 
06108                 unsigned int Result = 0; 
06109  
06110                 while (*str) 
06111                 { 
06112                         Result += static_cast<unsigned int>(*str++); 
06113                         Result += Result << 10; 
06114                         Result ^= Result >> 6; 
06115                 } 
06116          
06117                 Result += Result << 3; 
06118                 Result ^= Result >> 11; 
06119                 Result += Result << 15; 
06120          
06121                 return Result; 
06122         } 
06123  
06124         template <typename T> T* new_XPathVariable(const char_t* Name) 
06125         { 
06126                 size_t length = strlength(Name); 
06127                 if (length == 0) return 0; // empty variable names are invalid 
06128  
06129                 // $$ we can't use offsetof(T, Name) because T is non-POD, so we just allocate additional length characters 
06130                 void* memory = global_allocate(sizeof(T) + length * sizeof(char_t)); 
06131                 if (!memory) return 0; 
06132  
06133                 T* Result = new (memory) T(); 
06134  
06135                 memcpy(Result->Name, Name, (length + 1) * sizeof(char_t)); 
06136  
06137                 return Result; 
06138         } 
06139  
06140         XPathVariable* new_XPathVariable(XPathValueType Type, const char_t* Name) 
06141         { 
06142                 switch (Type) 
06143                 { 
06144                 case XPathTypeNodeSet: 
06145                         return new_XPathVariable<XPathVariableNodeSet>(Name); 
06146  
06147                 case XPathTypeNumber: 
06148                         return new_XPathVariable<XPathVariableNumber>(Name); 
06149  
06150                 case XPathTypeString: 
06151                         return new_XPathVariable<XPathVariableString>(Name); 
06152  
06153                 case XPathTypeBoolean: 
06154                         return new_XPathVariable<XPathVariableBoolean>(Name); 
06155  
06156                 default: 
06157                         return 0; 
06158                 } 
06159         } 
06160  
06161         template <typename T> void delete_XPathVariable(T* var) 
06162         { 
06163                 var->~T(); 
06164                 global_deallocate(var); 
06165         } 
06166  
06167         void delete_XPathVariable(XPathValueType Type, XPathVariable* var) 
06168         { 
06169                 switch (Type) 
06170                 { 
06171                 case XPathTypeNodeSet: 
06172                         delete_XPathVariable(static_cast<XPathVariableNodeSet*>(var)); 
06173                         break; 
06174  
06175                 case XPathTypeNumber: 
06176                         delete_XPathVariable(static_cast<XPathVariableNumber*>(var)); 
06177                         break; 
06178  
06179                 case XPathTypeString: 
06180                         delete_XPathVariable(static_cast<XPathVariableString*>(var)); 
06181                         break; 
06182  
06183                 case XPathTypeBoolean: 
06184                         delete_XPathVariable(static_cast<XPathVariableBoolean*>(var)); 
06185                         break; 
06186  
06187                 default: 
06188                         assert(!"Invalid variable Type"); 
06189                 } 
06190         } 
06191  
06192         XPathVariable* GetVariable(XPathVariableSet* set, const char_t* begin, const char_t* end) 
06193         { 
06194                 char_t buffer[32]; 
06195  
06196                 size_t length = static_cast<size_t>(end - begin); 
06197                 char_t* scratch = buffer; 
06198  
06199                 if (length >= sizeof(buffer) / sizeof(buffer[0])) 
06200                 { 
06201                         // need to make dummy on-heap copy 
06202                         scratch = static_cast<char_t*>(global_allocate((length + 1) * sizeof(char_t))); 
06203                         if (!scratch) return 0; 
06204                 } 
06205  
06206                 // copy string to zero-terminated buffer and perform lookup 
06207                 memcpy(scratch, begin, length * sizeof(char_t)); 
06208                 scratch[length] = 0; 
06209  
06210                 XPathVariable* Result = set->Get(scratch); 
06211  
06212                 // free dummy buffer 
06213                 if (scratch != buffer) global_deallocate(scratch); 
06214  
06215                 return Result; 
06216         } 
06217 } 
06218  
06219 // Internal node set class 
06220 namespace 
06221 { 
06222         XPathNodeSet::CollectionType XPathSort(XPathNode* begin, XPathNode* end, XPathNodeSet::CollectionType Type, bool rev) 
06223         { 
06224                 XPathNodeSet::CollectionType order = rev ? XPathNodeSet::TypeSortedReverse : XPathNodeSet::TypeSorted; 
06225  
06226                 if (Type == XPathNodeSet::TypeUnsorted) 
06227                 { 
06228                         sort(begin, end, document_order_comparator()); 
06229  
06230                         Type = XPathNodeSet::TypeSorted; 
06231                 } 
06232                  
06233                 if (Type != order) reverse(begin, end); 
06234                          
06235                 return order; 
06236         } 
06237  
06238         XPathNode XPathFirst(const XPathNode* begin, const XPathNode* end, XPathNodeSet::CollectionType Type) 
06239         { 
06240                 if (begin == end) return XPathNode(); 
06241  
06242                 switch (Type) 
06243                 { 
06244                 case XPathNodeSet::TypeSorted: 
06245                         return *begin; 
06246  
06247                 case XPathNodeSet::TypeSortedReverse: 
06248                         return *(end - 1); 
06249  
06250                 case XPathNodeSet::TypeUnsorted: 
06251                         return *min_element(begin, end, document_order_comparator()); 
06252  
06253                 default: 
06254                         assert(!"Invalid node set Type"); 
06255                         return XPathNode(); 
06256                 } 
06257         } 
06258         class XPathNodeSet_raw 
06259         { 
06260                 XPathNodeSet::CollectionType _type; 
06261  
06262                 XPathNode* _begin; 
06263                 XPathNode* _end; 
06264                 XPathNode* _eos; 
06265  
06266         public: 
06267                 XPathNodeSet_raw(): _type(XPathNodeSet::TypeUnsorted), _begin(0), _end(0), _eos(0) 
06268                 { 
06269                 } 
06270  
06271                 XPathNode* begin() const 
06272                 { 
06273                         return _begin; 
06274                 } 
06275  
06276                 XPathNode* end() const 
06277                 { 
06278                         return _end; 
06279                 } 
06280  
06281                 bool Empty() const 
06282                 { 
06283                         return _begin == _end; 
06284                 } 
06285  
06286                 size_t size() const 
06287                 { 
06288                         return static_cast<size_t>(_end - _begin); 
06289                 } 
06290  
06291                 XPathNode first() const 
06292                 { 
06293                         return XPathFirst(_begin, _end, _type); 
06294                 } 
06295  
06296                 void push_back(const XPathNode& node, XPathAllocator* alloc) 
06297                 { 
06298                         if (_end == _eos) 
06299                         { 
06300                                 size_t capacity = static_cast<size_t>(_eos - _begin); 
06301  
06302                                 // get new capacity (1.5x rule) 
06303                                 size_t new_capacity = capacity + capacity / 2 + 1; 
06304  
06305                                 // reallocate the old array or allocate a new one 
06306                                 XPathNode* data = static_cast<XPathNode*>(alloc->reallocate(_begin, capacity * sizeof(XPathNode), new_capacity * sizeof(XPathNode))); 
06307                                 assert(data); 
06308  
06309                                 // finalize 
06310                                 _begin = data; 
06311                                 _end = data + capacity; 
06312                                 _eos = data + new_capacity; 
06313                         } 
06314  
06315                         *_end++ = node; 
06316                 } 
06317  
06318                 void append(const XPathNode* begin, const XPathNode* end, XPathAllocator* alloc) 
06319                 { 
06320                         size_t size = static_cast<size_t>(_end - _begin); 
06321                         size_t capacity = static_cast<size_t>(_eos - _begin); 
06322                         size_t count = static_cast<size_t>(end - begin); 
06323  
06324                         if (size + count > capacity) 
06325                         { 
06326                                 // reallocate the old array or allocate a new one 
06327                                 XPathNode* data = static_cast<XPathNode*>(alloc->reallocate(_begin, capacity * sizeof(XPathNode), (size + count) * sizeof(XPathNode))); 
06328                                 assert(data); 
06329  
06330                                 // finalize 
06331                                 _begin = data; 
06332                                 _end = data + size; 
06333                                 _eos = data + size + count; 
06334                         } 
06335  
06336                         memcpy(_end, begin, count * sizeof(XPathNode)); 
06337                         _end += count; 
06338                 } 
06339  
06340                 void sort_do() 
06341                 { 
06342                         _type = XPathSort(_begin, _end, _type, false); 
06343                 } 
06344  
06345                 void truncate(XPathNode* pos) 
06346                 { 
06347                         assert(_begin <= pos && pos <= _end); 
06348  
06349                         _end = pos; 
06350                 } 
06351  
06352                 void RemoveDuplicates() 
06353                 { 
06354                         if (_type == XPathNodeSet::TypeUnsorted) 
06355                                 sort(_begin, _end, duplicate_comparator()); 
06356                  
06357                         _end = unique(_begin, _end); 
06358                 } 
06359  
06360                 XPathNodeSet::CollectionType Type() const 
06361                 { 
06362                         return _type; 
06363                 } 
06364  
06365                 void SetType(XPathNodeSet::CollectionType Type) 
06366                 { 
06367                         _type = Type; 
06368                 } 
06369         }; 
06370 } 
06371  
06372 namespace 
06373 { 
06374         struct XPathContext 
06375         { 
06376                 XPathNode n; 
06377                 size_t position, size; 
06378  
06379                 XPathContext(const XPathNode& n, size_t position, size_t size): n(n), position(position), size(size) 
06380                 { 
06381                 } 
06382         }; 
06383  
06384         enum lexeme_t 
06385         { 
06386                 lex_none = 0, 
06387                 lex_equal, 
06388                 lex_not_equal, 
06389                 lex_less, 
06390                 lex_greater, 
06391                 lex_less_or_equal, 
06392                 lex_greater_or_equal, 
06393                 lex_plus, 
06394                 lex_minus, 
06395                 lex_multiply, 
06396                 lex_union, 
06397                 lex_var_ref, 
06398                 lex_open_brace, 
06399                 lex_close_brace, 
06400                 lex_quoted_string, 
06401                 lex_number, 
06402                 lex_slash, 
06403                 lex_double_slash, 
06404                 lex_open_square_brace, 
06405                 lex_close_square_brace, 
06406                 lex_string, 
06407                 lex_comma, 
06408                 lex_axis_attribute, 
06409                 lex_dot, 
06410                 lex_double_dot, 
06411                 lex_double_colon, 
06412                 lex_eof 
06413         }; 
06414  
06415         struct XPathLexerString 
06416         { 
06417                 const char_t* begin; 
06418                 const char_t* end; 
06419  
06420                 XPathLexerString(): begin(0), end(0) 
06421                 { 
06422                 } 
06423  
06424                 bool operator==(const char_t* other) const 
06425                 { 
06426                         size_t length = static_cast<size_t>(end - begin); 
06427  
06428                         return strequalrange(other, begin, length); 
06429                 } 
06430         }; 
06431  
06432         class XPathLexer 
06433         { 
06434                 const char_t* _cur; 
06435                 const char_t* _cur_lexeme_pos; 
06436                 XPathLexerString _cur_lexeme_contents; 
06437  
06438                 lexeme_t _cur_lexeme; 
06439  
06440         public: 
06441                 explicit XPathLexer(const char_t* query): _cur(query) 
06442                 { 
06443                         next(); 
06444                 } 
06445                  
06446                 const char_t* state() const 
06447                 { 
06448                         return _cur; 
06449                 } 
06450                  
06451                 void next() 
06452                 { 
06453                         const char_t* cur = _cur; 
06454  
06455                         while (IS_CHARTYPE(*cur, ct_space)) ++cur; 
06456  
06457                         // Save lexeme position for error reporting 
06458                         _cur_lexeme_pos = cur; 
06459  
06460                         switch (*cur) 
06461                         { 
06462                         case 0: 
06463                                 _cur_lexeme = lex_eof; 
06464                                 break; 
06465                          
06466                         case '>': 
06467                                 if (*(cur+1) == '=') 
06468                                 { 
06469                                         cur += 2; 
06470                                         _cur_lexeme = lex_greater_or_equal; 
06471                                 } 
06472                                 else 
06473                                 { 
06474                                         cur += 1; 
06475                                         _cur_lexeme = lex_greater; 
06476                                 } 
06477                                 break; 
06478  
06479                         case '<': 
06480                                 if (*(cur+1) == '=') 
06481                                 { 
06482                                         cur += 2; 
06483                                         _cur_lexeme = lex_less_or_equal; 
06484                                 } 
06485                                 else 
06486                                 { 
06487                                         cur += 1; 
06488                                         _cur_lexeme = lex_less; 
06489                                 } 
06490                                 break; 
06491  
06492                         case '!': 
06493                                 if (*(cur+1) == '=') 
06494                                 { 
06495                                         cur += 2; 
06496                                         _cur_lexeme = lex_not_equal; 
06497                                 } 
06498                                 else 
06499                                 { 
06500                                         _cur_lexeme = lex_none; 
06501                                 } 
06502                                 break; 
06503  
06504                         case '=': 
06505                                 cur += 1; 
06506                                 _cur_lexeme = lex_equal; 
06507  
06508                                 break; 
06509                          
06510                         case '+': 
06511                                 cur += 1; 
06512                                 _cur_lexeme = lex_plus; 
06513  
06514                                 break; 
06515  
06516                         case '-': 
06517                                 cur += 1; 
06518                                 _cur_lexeme = lex_minus; 
06519  
06520                                 break; 
06521  
06522                         case '*': 
06523                                 cur += 1; 
06524                                 _cur_lexeme = lex_multiply; 
06525  
06526                                 break; 
06527  
06528                         case '|': 
06529                                 cur += 1; 
06530                                 _cur_lexeme = lex_union; 
06531  
06532                                 break; 
06533                          
06534                         case '$': 
06535                                 cur += 1; 
06536  
06537                                 if (IS_CHARTYPEX(*cur, ctx_start_symbol)) 
06538                                 { 
06539                                         _cur_lexeme_contents.begin = cur; 
06540  
06541                                         while (IS_CHARTYPEX(*cur, ctx_symbol)) cur++; 
06542  
06543                                         if (cur[0] == ':' && IS_CHARTYPEX(cur[1], ctx_symbol)) // qName 
06544                                         { 
06545                                                 cur++; // : 
06546  
06547                                                 while (IS_CHARTYPEX(*cur, ctx_symbol)) cur++; 
06548                                         } 
06549  
06550                                         _cur_lexeme_contents.end = cur; 
06551                                  
06552                                         _cur_lexeme = lex_var_ref; 
06553                                 } 
06554                                 else 
06555                                 { 
06556                                         _cur_lexeme = lex_none; 
06557                                 } 
06558  
06559                                 break; 
06560  
06561                         case '(': 
06562                                 cur += 1; 
06563                                 _cur_lexeme = lex_open_brace; 
06564  
06565                                 break; 
06566  
06567                         case ')': 
06568                                 cur += 1; 
06569                                 _cur_lexeme = lex_close_brace; 
06570  
06571                                 break; 
06572                          
06573                         case '[': 
06574                                 cur += 1; 
06575                                 _cur_lexeme = lex_open_square_brace; 
06576  
06577                                 break; 
06578  
06579                         case ']': 
06580                                 cur += 1; 
06581                                 _cur_lexeme = lex_close_square_brace; 
06582  
06583                                 break; 
06584  
06585                         case ',': 
06586                                 cur += 1; 
06587                                 _cur_lexeme = lex_comma; 
06588  
06589                                 break; 
06590  
06591                         case '/': 
06592                                 if (*(cur+1) == '/') 
06593                                 { 
06594                                         cur += 2; 
06595                                         _cur_lexeme = lex_double_slash; 
06596                                 } 
06597                                 else 
06598                                 { 
06599                                         cur += 1; 
06600                                         _cur_lexeme = lex_slash; 
06601                                 } 
06602                                 break; 
06603                  
06604                         case '.': 
06605                                 if (*(cur+1) == '.') 
06606                                 { 
06607                                         cur += 2; 
06608                                         _cur_lexeme = lex_double_dot; 
06609                                 } 
06610                                 else if (IS_CHARTYPEX(*(cur+1), ctx_digit)) 
06611                                 { 
06612                                         _cur_lexeme_contents.begin = cur; // . 
06613  
06614                                         ++cur; 
06615  
06616                                         while (IS_CHARTYPEX(*cur, ctx_digit)) cur++; 
06617  
06618                                         _cur_lexeme_contents.end = cur; 
06619                                          
06620                                         _cur_lexeme = lex_number; 
06621                                 } 
06622                                 else 
06623                                 { 
06624                                         cur += 1; 
06625                                         _cur_lexeme = lex_dot; 
06626                                 } 
06627                                 break; 
06628  
06629                         case '@': 
06630                                 cur += 1; 
06631                                 _cur_lexeme = lex_axis_attribute; 
06632  
06633                                 break; 
06634  
06635                         case '"': 
06636                         case '\'': 
06637                         { 
06638                                 char_t terminator = *cur; 
06639  
06640                                 ++cur; 
06641  
06642                                 _cur_lexeme_contents.begin = cur; 
06643                                 while (*cur && *cur != terminator) cur++; 
06644                                 _cur_lexeme_contents.end = cur; 
06645                                  
06646                                 if (!*cur) 
06647                                         _cur_lexeme = lex_none; 
06648                                 else 
06649                                 { 
06650                                         cur += 1; 
06651                                         _cur_lexeme = lex_quoted_string; 
06652                                 } 
06653  
06654                                 break; 
06655                         } 
06656  
06657                         case ':': 
06658                                 if (*(cur+1) == ':') 
06659                                 { 
06660                                         cur += 2; 
06661                                         _cur_lexeme = lex_double_colon; 
06662                                 } 
06663                                 else 
06664                                 { 
06665                                         _cur_lexeme = lex_none; 
06666                                 } 
06667                                 break; 
06668  
06669                         default: 
06670                                 if (IS_CHARTYPEX(*cur, ctx_digit)) 
06671                                 { 
06672                                         _cur_lexeme_contents.begin = cur; 
06673  
06674                                         while (IS_CHARTYPEX(*cur, ctx_digit)) cur++; 
06675                                  
06676                                         if (*cur == '.') 
06677                                         { 
06678                                                 cur++; 
06679  
06680                                                 while (IS_CHARTYPEX(*cur, ctx_digit)) cur++; 
06681                                         } 
06682  
06683                                         _cur_lexeme_contents.end = cur; 
06684  
06685                                         _cur_lexeme = lex_number; 
06686                                 } 
06687                                 else if (IS_CHARTYPEX(*cur, ctx_start_symbol)) 
06688                                 { 
06689                                         _cur_lexeme_contents.begin = cur; 
06690  
06691                                         while (IS_CHARTYPEX(*cur, ctx_symbol)) cur++; 
06692  
06693                                         if (cur[0] == ':') 
06694                                         { 
06695                                                 if (cur[1] == '*') // namespace test ncName:* 
06696                                                 { 
06697                                                         cur += 2; // :* 
06698                                                 } 
06699                                                 else if (IS_CHARTYPEX(cur[1], ctx_symbol)) // namespace test qName 
06700                                                 { 
06701                                                         cur++; // : 
06702  
06703                                                         while (IS_CHARTYPEX(*cur, ctx_symbol)) cur++; 
06704                                                 } 
06705                                         } 
06706  
06707                                         _cur_lexeme_contents.end = cur; 
06708                                  
06709                                         _cur_lexeme = lex_string; 
06710                                 } 
06711                                 else 
06712                                 { 
06713                                         _cur_lexeme = lex_none; 
06714                                 } 
06715                         } 
06716  
06717                         _cur = cur; 
06718                 } 
06719  
06720                 lexeme_t current() const 
06721                 { 
06722                         return _cur_lexeme; 
06723                 } 
06724  
06725                 const char_t* current_pos() const 
06726                 { 
06727                         return _cur_lexeme_pos; 
06728                 } 
06729  
06730                 const XPathLexerString& contents() const 
06731                 { 
06732                         assert(_cur_lexeme == lex_var_ref || _cur_lexeme == lex_number || _cur_lexeme == lex_string || _cur_lexeme == lex_quoted_string); 
06733  
06734                         return _cur_lexeme_contents; 
06735                 } 
06736         }; 
06737  
06738         enum ast_type_t 
06739         { 
06740                 ast_op_or,                                              // left or right 
06741                 ast_op_and,                                             // left and right 
06742                 ast_op_equal,                                   // left = right 
06743                 ast_op_not_equal,                               // left != right 
06744                 ast_op_less,                                    // left < right 
06745                 ast_op_greater,                                 // left > right 
06746                 ast_op_less_or_equal,                   // left <= right 
06747                 ast_op_greater_or_equal,                // left >= right 
06748                 ast_op_add,                                             // left + right 
06749                 ast_op_subtract,                                // left - right 
06750                 ast_op_multiply,                                // left * right 
06751                 ast_op_divide,                                  // left / right 
06752                 ast_op_mod,                                             // left % right 
06753                 ast_op_negate,                                  // left - right 
06754                 ast_op_union,                                   // left | right 
06755                 ast_predicate,                                  // apply predicate to set; next points to next predicate 
06756                 ast_filter,                                             // select * from left where right 
06757                 ast_filter_posinv,                              // select * from left where right; proximity position invariant 
06758                 ast_string_constant,                    // string constant 
06759                 ast_number_constant,                    // number constant 
06760                 ast_variable,                                   // variable 
06761                 ast_func_last,                                  // last() 
06762                 ast_func_position,                              // position() 
06763                 ast_func_count,                                 // count(left) 
06764                 ast_func_id,                                    // id(left) 
06765                 ast_func_local_Name_0,                  // local-Name() 
06766                 ast_func_local_Name_1,                  // local-Name(left) 
06767                 ast_func_namespace_uri_0,               // namespace-uri() 
06768                 ast_func_namespace_uri_1,               // namespace-uri(left) 
06769                 ast_func_Name_0,                                // Name() 
06770                 ast_func_Name_1,                                // Name(left) 
06771                 ast_func_string_0,                              // string() 
06772                 ast_func_string_1,                              // string(left) 
06773                 ast_func_concat,                                // concat(left, right, siblings) 
06774                 ast_func_starts_with,                   // starts_with(left, right) 
06775                 ast_func_contains,                              // contains(left, right) 
06776                 ast_func_substring_before,              // substring-before(left, right) 
06777                 ast_func_substring_after,               // substring-after(left, right) 
06778                 ast_func_substring_2,                   // substring(left, right) 
06779                 ast_func_substring_3,                   // substring(left, right, third) 
06780                 ast_func_string_length_0,               // string-length() 
06781                 ast_func_string_length_1,               // string-length(left) 
06782                 ast_func_normalize_space_0,             // normalize-space() 
06783                 ast_func_normalize_space_1,             // normalize-space(left) 
06784                 ast_func_translate,                             // translate(left, right, third) 
06785                 ast_func_boolean,                               // boolean(left) 
06786                 ast_func_not,                                   // not(left) 
06787                 ast_func_true,                                  // true() 
06788                 ast_func_false,                                 // false() 
06789                 ast_func_lang,                                  // lang(left) 
06790                 ast_func_number_0,                              // number() 
06791                 ast_func_number_1,                              // number(left) 
06792                 ast_func_sum,                                   // sum(left) 
06793                 ast_func_floor,                                 // floor(left) 
06794                 ast_func_ceiling,                               // ceiling(left) 
06795                 ast_func_round,                                 // round(left) 
06796                 ast_step,                                               // process set left with step 
06797                 ast_step_GetRoot                                        // select GetRoot node 
06798         }; 
06799  
06800         enum axis_t 
06801         { 
06802                 axis_ancestor, 
06803                 axis_ancestor_or_self, 
06804                 axis_attribute, 
06805                 axis_GetChild, 
06806                 axis_descendant, 
06807                 axis_descendant_or_self, 
06808                 axis_following, 
06809                 axis_following_sibling, 
06810                 axis_namespace, 
06811                 axis_GetParent, 
06812                 axis_preceding, 
06813                 axis_preceding_sibling, 
06814                 axis_self 
06815         }; 
06816          
06817         enum nodetest_t 
06818         { 
06819                 nodetest_none, 
06820                 nodetest_Name, 
06821                 nodetest_type_node, 
06822                 nodetest_type_comment, 
06823                 nodetest_type_pi, 
06824                 nodetest_type_text, 
06825                 nodetest_pi, 
06826                 nodetest_all, 
06827                 nodetest_all_in_namespace 
06828         }; 
06829  
06830         template <axis_t N> struct axis_to_type 
06831         { 
06832                 static const axis_t axis; 
06833         }; 
06834  
06835         template <axis_t N> const axis_t axis_to_type<N>::axis = N; 
06836                  
06837         class XPathAstNode 
06838         { 
06839         private: 
06840                 // node Type 
06841                 char _type; 
06842                 char _retType; 
06843  
06844                 // for ast_step / ast_predicate 
06845                 char _axis; 
06846                 char _test; 
06847  
06848                 // tree node structure 
06849                 XPathAstNode* _left; 
06850                 XPathAstNode* _right; 
06851                 XPathAstNode* _next; 
06852  
06853                 union 
06854                 { 
06855                         // Value for ast_string_constant 
06856                         const char_t* string; 
06857                         // Value for ast_number_constant 
06858                         double number; 
06859                         // variable for ast_variable 
06860                         XPathVariable* variable; 
06861                         // node test for ast_step (node Name/namespace/node Type/pi target) 
06862                         const char_t* nodetest; 
06863                 } _data; 
06864  
06865                 XPathAstNode(const XPathAstNode&); 
06866                 XPathAstNode& operator=(const XPathAstNode&); 
06867  
06868                 template <class Comp> static bool compare_eq(XPathAstNode* lhs, XPathAstNode* rhs, const XPathContext& c, const XPathStack& stack, const Comp& comp) 
06869                 { 
06870                         XPathValueType lt = lhs->retType(), rt = rhs->retType(); 
06871  
06872                         if (lt != XPathTypeNodeSet && rt != XPathTypeNodeSet) 
06873                         { 
06874                                 if (lt == XPathTypeBoolean || rt == XPathTypeBoolean) 
06875                                         return comp(lhs->eval_boolean(c, stack), rhs->eval_boolean(c, stack)); 
06876                                 else if (lt == XPathTypeNumber || rt == XPathTypeNumber) 
06877                                         return comp(lhs->eval_number(c, stack), rhs->eval_number(c, stack)); 
06878                                 else if (lt == XPathTypeString || rt == XPathTypeString) 
06879                                 { 
06880                                         XPathAllocatorCapture cr(stack.Result); 
06881  
06882                                         XPathString ls = lhs->eval_string(c, stack); 
06883                                         XPathString rs = rhs->eval_string(c, stack); 
06884  
06885                                         return comp(ls, rs); 
06886                                 } 
06887                         } 
06888                         else if (lt == XPathTypeNodeSet && rt == XPathTypeNodeSet) 
06889                         { 
06890                                 XPathAllocatorCapture cr(stack.Result); 
06891  
06892                                 XPathNodeSet_raw ls = lhs->eval_NodeSet(c, stack); 
06893                                 XPathNodeSet_raw rs = rhs->eval_NodeSet(c, stack); 
06894  
06895                                 for (const XPathNode* li = ls.begin(); li != ls.end(); ++li) 
06896                                         for (const XPathNode* ri = rs.begin(); ri != rs.end(); ++ri) 
06897                                         { 
06898                                                 XPathAllocatorCapture cri(stack.Result); 
06899  
06900                                                 if (comp(string_Value(*li, stack.Result), string_Value(*ri, stack.Result))) 
06901                                                         return true; 
06902                                         } 
06903  
06904                                 return false; 
06905                         } 
06906                         else 
06907                         { 
06908                                 if (lt == XPathTypeNodeSet) 
06909                                 { 
06910                                         swap(lhs, rhs); 
06911                                         swap(lt, rt); 
06912                                 } 
06913  
06914                                 if (lt == XPathTypeBoolean) 
06915                                         return comp(lhs->eval_boolean(c, stack), rhs->eval_boolean(c, stack)); 
06916                                 else if (lt == XPathTypeNumber) 
06917                                 { 
06918                                         XPathAllocatorCapture cr(stack.Result); 
06919  
06920                                         double l = lhs->eval_number(c, stack); 
06921                                         XPathNodeSet_raw rs = rhs->eval_NodeSet(c, stack); 
06922  
06923                                         for (const XPathNode* ri = rs.begin(); ri != rs.end(); ++ri) 
06924                                         { 
06925                                                 XPathAllocatorCapture cri(stack.Result); 
06926  
06927                                                 if (comp(l, convert_Stringo_number(string_Value(*ri, stack.Result).c_str()))) 
06928                                                         return true; 
06929                                         } 
06930  
06931                                         return false; 
06932                                 } 
06933                                 else if (lt == XPathTypeString) 
06934                                 { 
06935                                         XPathAllocatorCapture cr(stack.Result); 
06936  
06937                                         XPathString l = lhs->eval_string(c, stack); 
06938                                         XPathNodeSet_raw rs = rhs->eval_NodeSet(c, stack); 
06939  
06940                                         for (const XPathNode* ri = rs.begin(); ri != rs.end(); ++ri) 
06941                                         { 
06942                                                 XPathAllocatorCapture cri(stack.Result); 
06943  
06944                                                 if (comp(l, string_Value(*ri, stack.Result))) 
06945                                                         return true; 
06946                                         } 
06947  
06948                                         return false; 
06949                                 } 
06950                         } 
06951  
06952                         assert(!"Wrong Types"); 
06953                         return false; 
06954                 } 
06955  
06956                 template <class Comp> static bool compare_rel(XPathAstNode* lhs, XPathAstNode* rhs, const XPathContext& c, const XPathStack& stack, const Comp& comp) 
06957                 { 
06958                         XPathValueType lt = lhs->retType(), rt = rhs->retType(); 
06959  
06960                         if (lt != XPathTypeNodeSet && rt != XPathTypeNodeSet) 
06961                                 return comp(lhs->eval_number(c, stack), rhs->eval_number(c, stack)); 
06962                         else if (lt == XPathTypeNodeSet && rt == XPathTypeNodeSet) 
06963                         { 
06964                                 XPathAllocatorCapture cr(stack.Result); 
06965  
06966                                 XPathNodeSet_raw ls = lhs->eval_NodeSet(c, stack); 
06967                                 XPathNodeSet_raw rs = rhs->eval_NodeSet(c, stack); 
06968  
06969                                 for (const XPathNode* li = ls.begin(); li != ls.end(); ++li) 
06970                                 { 
06971                                         XPathAllocatorCapture cri(stack.Result); 
06972
